Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.title: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 | Rotten Tomatoes
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.snippet: Upcoming in 2025. Watch for Free. Holiday Movies & Streaming.Golden Globe Nominations 2026 : The Full List of Nominees. Weekend Box Office: Five Nights at Freddy’s 2 Scares up a Massive $63 Million Opening.
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.content: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025							 | 	Rotten Tomatoes About Rotten Tomatoes® Critics Home Box Office TV DVD MORE News Movies TV Shows RT App News Showtimes Trending on RT News The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 There's plenty of superheroic action, blockbuster thrills, and family-friendly fare, but also some noteworthy indies and potential gems to look forward to. by Christina Liu | November 5, 2025							| Comments TAGGED AS: movies As movie theater prices continue to increase (let’s not even talk about those concessions), we know it can be tough to figure out which movies to spend your hard-earned money on. With that in mind, here’s a handy calendar of some of the most noteworthy titles coming in 2025 so you can budget and plan accordingly. Recommended: The Best Movies of 2025 Recommended: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2024 January – November DECEMBER Five Nights at Freddy's 2 (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Emma Tammi Starring: Elizabeth Lail, Josh Hutcherson, Matthew Lillard, Piper Rubio Come one, come all: Freddy Fazbear’s Pizza is reopening its doors for a Five Nights at Freddy’s sequel . Based on the titular superhit video game, and following the trend of video game movies, the hauntingly familiar animatronics are reawakening for their second round of frights. The first installment raked in upwards of $80 million in its box office run and saw record numbers on Peacock during its streaming release for Blumhouse — all despite poor reviews — making a second film a no-brainer for the studio. Fackham Hall (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Jim O’Hanlon Starring: Damian Lewis, Katherine Waterston, Thomasin McKenzie, Tom Felton When a new porter forms an unlikely connection with the youngest daughter of the esteemed Davenport family, his arrival coincides with a disastrous wedding that threatens to unravel the family’s prim-and-proper façade. Think Downton Abbey meets The Favourite , with a twist. Jay Kelly (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Noah Baumbach Starring: George Clooney, Adam Sandler, Laura Dern Jay Kelly , the latest film from Academy Award nominee Noah Baumbach, follows famed movie star Jay Kelly (George Clooney) and his loyal manager Ron (Adam Sandler) on a press tour throughout Europe. Both men confront the choices that shaped their lives. Thoughtful, funny, and bittersweet, critics haave praised Baumbach for his newest feature. Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery (2025) Release Date: December 12, 2025 Director: Rian Johnson Starring: Cailee Spaeny, Glenn Close, Kerry Washington The Knives Out franchise welcomes a new mystery, starring Daniel Craig as the famous detective Benoit Blanc. While not much is known about the plot, this film has been titled as the detective’s most dangerous case yet. The film will also feature new faces, including Josh O’Connor. Ella McCay (2025) Release Date: December 12, 2025 Director: James L. Brooks Starring: Woody Harrelson, Ayo Edebiri, Jack Lowden Ella McCay will bring viewers to Rhode Island in this James Brooks film starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Emma Mackey, and Woody Harrelson. This comedy centers on a politician who becomes the Ocean State’s next governor and has to balance her new job and personal life. Avatar: Fire and Ash (2025) Release Date: December 19, 2025 Director: James Cameron Starring: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldaña, Sigourney Weaver, David Thewlis, Stephen Lang, Giovanni Ribisi, Michelle Yeoh, Oona Chaplin The third film of the Avatar franchise brings audiences back to Pandora and the Na’vi, this time with new biomes and new clans. The “Ash People” will represent fire and depict Na’vi who are not as kind as those we’ve seen before. New additions to the cast include Michelle Yeoh, playing human scientist Dr. Karina Mogue, and Oona Chaplin, playing the villain Na’vi Varang. Avatar 3 follows on the heels of the box office juggernaut Avatar: The Way of Water , and the first act of the fourth film has also already been shot. The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants (2025) Release Date: December 19, 2025 Director: Derek Drymon Starring: Tom Kenny, Clancy Brown, Brian Doyle-Murray, Bill Fagerbakke, Rodger Bumpass, Mr. Lawrence, Carolyn Lawrence SpongeBob SquarePants and friends are coming back to the big screen. The fourth movie centers on SpongeBob’s adventures in the deep sea, facing the ghost of the Flying Dutchman. The original SpongeBob SquarePants TV series has been running since 1999 and is currently in its 14th season. The Housemaid (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Paul Feig Starring: Sydney Sweeney, Amanda Seyfried, Brandon Sklenar, Michele Morrone Paul Feig’s latest film is a psychological thriller based on the 2022 novel of the same name by Freida McFadden. Sydney Sweeney stars as a struggling woman who finds work as a housemaid for an affluent couple (Amanda Seyfried and It Ends with Us ‘ Brandon Sklenar), only to discover her new employers may harbor some dark secrets. In other words, perfect Christmas Day viewing. Marty Supreme (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Josh Safdie Starring: Timothée Chalamet, Odessa A’zion, Gwyneth Paltrow Josh Safdie’s sports drama stars Timothée Chalamet as Marty Reisman, the renowned Table Tennis player who, at 22, won five bronze medals at the World Table Tennis Championships. Aside from his successful career, Reisman faced numerous tribulations throughout his life. Along will Chalamet, Odessa A’zion and Gwyneth Paltrow bring this story to life. Anaconda (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Tom Gormican Starring: Steve Zahn, Paul Rudd, Jack Black, Daniela Melchior, Thandiwe Newton, Selton Mello The giant man-eating snake returns to screens in this cheeky update of the 1997 film that starred Jennifer Lopez and Ice Cube. While the original was a horror movie, the 2025 version will flip the story on its head to retell it as a comedy while still honoring its horror roots. The Testament of Ann Lee (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Mona Fastvoid Starring: Amanda Seyfried, Thomasin McKenzie, Lewis Pullman Amanda Seyfried stars as Ann Lee, the founding leader of the Shaker Movement who was declared the female Christ by her followers. The film chronicles her creation of a utopian community defined by worship through song and dance. Already earning a Certified Fresh score of 90%, The Testament of Ann Lee is being hailed as one of the year’s most powerful historical dramas. TBD In The Grey (2025) Release Date: TBD Director: Guy Ritchie Starring: Jake Gyllenhaal, Henry Cavill, Eiza Gonzalez, Rosamund Pike, Fisher Stevens Jake Gyllenhaal, hot off Prime Video’s Road House , repurposes the tough-guy attitude in a new action thriller directed by Guy Ritchie. Gyllenhall previously starred in Ritchie’s war thriller, Guy Ritchie’s The Covenant , and will team up with Henry Cavill and Eiza Gonzalez, who reunite after Ritchie’s The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare . Together, the three form a gang of badasses determined to rescue billions stolen from them. January – November On an Apple device? Follow Rotten Tomatoes on Apple News. I, of course, am referencing all the great pop culture there will be to enjoy (I can't speak to what's going on in the rest of life). In preparation, we've got you the perfect gift: our 2026 Preview issue, highlighting the upcoming TV shows and movies that have us most excited. Led by Tracy Morgan and Daniel Radcliffe — the stars of The Fall and Rise of Reggie Dinkins , NBC's new comedy from the 30 Rock creative team — the issue celebrates 10 projects we can't wait to see, but keep coming back to EW through Dec. 22 for exclusive looks at a handful more. May your holidays (and streaming queues) be merry and bright. Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.title: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 | Rotten Tomatoes
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.snippet: Upcoming in 2025. Watch for Free. Holiday Movies & Streaming.There's plenty of superheroic action, blockbuster thrills, and family-friendly fare, but also some noteworthy indies and potential gems to look forward to.
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.content: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025							 | 	Rotten Tomatoes About Rotten Tomatoes® Critics Home Box Office TV DVD MORE News Movies TV Shows RT App News Showtimes Trending on RT News The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 There's plenty of superheroic action, blockbuster thrills, and family-friendly fare, but also some noteworthy indies and potential gems to look forward to. by Christina Liu | November 5, 2025							| Comments TAGGED AS: movies As movie theater prices continue to increase (let’s not even talk about those concessions), we know it can be tough to figure out which movies to spend your hard-earned money on. With that in mind, here’s a handy calendar of some of the most noteworthy titles coming in 2025 so you can budget and plan accordingly. Recommended: The Best Movies of 2025 Recommended: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2024 January – November DECEMBER Five Nights at Freddy's 2 (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Emma Tammi Starring: Elizabeth Lail, Josh Hutcherson, Matthew Lillard, Piper Rubio Come one, come all: Freddy Fazbear’s Pizza is reopening its doors for a Five Nights at Freddy’s sequel . Based on the titular superhit video game, and following the trend of video game movies, the hauntingly familiar animatronics are reawakening for their second round of frights. The first installment raked in upwards of $80 million in its box office run and saw record numbers on Peacock during its streaming release for Blumhouse — all despite poor reviews — making a second film a no-brainer for the studio. Fackham Hall (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Jim O’Hanlon Starring: Damian Lewis, Katherine Waterston, Thomasin McKenzie, Tom Felton When a new porter forms an unlikely connection with the youngest daughter of the esteemed Davenport family, his arrival coincides with a disastrous wedding that threatens to unravel the family’s prim-and-proper façade. Think Downton Abbey meets The Favourite , with a twist. Jay Kelly (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Noah Baumbach Starring: George Clooney, Adam Sandler, Laura Dern Jay Kelly , the latest film from Academy Award nominee Noah Baumbach, follows famed movie star Jay Kelly (George Clooney) and his loyal manager Ron (Adam Sandler) on a press tour throughout Europe. Both men confront the choices that shaped their lives. Thoughtful, funny, and bittersweet, critics haave praised Baumbach for his newest feature. Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery (2025) Release Date: December 12, 2025 Director: Rian Johnson Starring: Cailee Spaeny, Glenn Close, Kerry Washington The Knives Out franchise welcomes a new mystery, starring Daniel Craig as the famous detective Benoit Blanc. While not much is known about the plot, this film has been titled as the detective’s most dangerous case yet. The film will also feature new faces, including Josh O’Connor. Ella McCay (2025) Release Date: December 12, 2025 Director: James L. Brooks Starring: Woody Harrelson, Ayo Edebiri, Jack Lowden Ella McCay will bring viewers to Rhode Island in this James Brooks film starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Emma Mackey, and Woody Harrelson. This comedy centers on a politician who becomes the Ocean State’s next governor and has to balance her new job and personal life. Avatar: Fire and Ash (2025) Release Date: December 19, 2025 Director: James Cameron Starring: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldaña, Sigourney Weaver, David Thewlis, Stephen Lang, Giovanni Ribisi, Michelle Yeoh, Oona Chaplin The third film of the Avatar franchise brings audiences back to Pandora and the Na’vi, this time with new biomes and new clans. The “Ash People” will represent fire and depict Na’vi who are not as kind as those we’ve seen before. New additions to the cast include Michelle Yeoh, playing human scientist Dr. Karina Mogue, and Oona Chaplin, playing the villain Na’vi Varang. Avatar 3 follows on the heels of the box office juggernaut Avatar: The Way of Water , and the first act of the fourth film has also already been shot. The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants (2025) Release Date: December 19, 2025 Director: Derek Drymon Starring: Tom Kenny, Clancy Brown, Brian Doyle-Murray, Bill Fagerbakke, Rodger Bumpass, Mr. Lawrence, Carolyn Lawrence SpongeBob SquarePants and friends are coming back to the big screen. The fourth movie centers on SpongeBob’s adventures in the deep sea, facing the ghost of the Flying Dutchman. The original SpongeBob SquarePants TV series has been running since 1999 and is currently in its 14th season. The Housemaid (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Paul Feig Starring: Sydney Sweeney, Amanda Seyfried, Brandon Sklenar, Michele Morrone Paul Feig’s latest film is a psychological thriller based on the 2022 novel of the same name by Freida McFadden. Sydney Sweeney stars as a struggling woman who finds work as a housemaid for an affluent couple (Amanda Seyfried and It Ends with Us ‘ Brandon Sklenar), only to discover her new employers may harbor some dark secrets. In other words, perfect Christmas Day viewing. Marty Supreme (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Josh Safdie Starring: Timothée Chalamet, Odessa A’zion, Gwyneth Paltrow Josh Safdie’s sports drama stars Timothée Chalamet as Marty Reisman, the renowned Table Tennis player who, at 22, won five bronze medals at the World Table Tennis Championships. Aside from his successful career, Reisman faced numerous tribulations throughout his life. Along will Chalamet, Odessa A’zion and Gwyneth Paltrow bring this story to life. Anaconda (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Tom Gormican Starring: Steve Zahn, Paul Rudd, Jack Black, Daniela Melchior, Thandiwe Newton, Selton Mello The giant man-eating snake returns to screens in this cheeky update of the 1997 film that starred Jennifer Lopez and Ice Cube. While the original was a horror movie, the 2025 version will flip the story on its head to retell it as a comedy while still honoring its horror roots. The Testament of Ann Lee (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Mona Fastvoid Starring: Amanda Seyfried, Thomasin McKenzie, Lewis Pullman Amanda Seyfried stars as Ann Lee, the founding leader of the Shaker Movement who was declared the female Christ by her followers. The film chronicles her creation of a utopian community defined by worship through song and dance. Already earning a Certified Fresh score of 90%, The Testament of Ann Lee is being hailed as one of the year’s most powerful historical dramas. TBD In The Grey (2025) Release Date: TBD Director: Guy Ritchie Starring: Jake Gyllenhaal, Henry Cavill, Eiza Gonzalez, Rosamund Pike, Fisher Stevens Jake Gyllenhaal, hot off Prime Video’s Road House , repurposes the tough-guy attitude in a new action thriller directed by Guy Ritchie. Gyllenhall previously starred in Ritchie’s war thriller, Guy Ritchie’s The Covenant , and will team up with Henry Cavill and Eiza Gonzalez, who reunite after Ritchie’s The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare . Together, the three form a gang of badasses determined to rescue billions stolen from them. January – November On an Apple device? Follow Rotten Tomatoes on Apple News. Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.title: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 | Rotten Tomatoes
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.snippet: Upcoming in 2025. Watch for Free. Holiday Movies & Streaming.Jay Kelly, the latest film from Academy Award nominee Noah Baumbach, follows famed movie star Jay Kelly (George Clooney) and his loyal manager Ron (Adam Sandler) on a press tour throughout Europe.
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.content: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025							 | 	Rotten Tomatoes About Rotten Tomatoes® Critics Home Box Office TV DVD MORE News Movies TV Shows RT App News Showtimes Trending on RT News The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 There's plenty of superheroic action, blockbuster thrills, and family-friendly fare, but also some noteworthy indies and potential gems to look forward to. by Christina Liu | November 5, 2025							| Comments TAGGED AS: movies As movie theater prices continue to increase (let’s not even talk about those concessions), we know it can be tough to figure out which movies to spend your hard-earned money on. With that in mind, here’s a handy calendar of some of the most noteworthy titles coming in 2025 so you can budget and plan accordingly. Recommended: The Best Movies of 2025 Recommended: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2024 January – November DECEMBER Five Nights at Freddy's 2 (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Emma Tammi Starring: Elizabeth Lail, Josh Hutcherson, Matthew Lillard, Piper Rubio Come one, come all: Freddy Fazbear’s Pizza is reopening its doors for a Five Nights at Freddy’s sequel . Based on the titular superhit video game, and following the trend of video game movies, the hauntingly familiar animatronics are reawakening for their second round of frights. The first installment raked in upwards of $80 million in its box office run and saw record numbers on Peacock during its streaming release for Blumhouse — all despite poor reviews — making a second film a no-brainer for the studio. Fackham Hall (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Jim O’Hanlon Starring: Damian Lewis, Katherine Waterston, Thomasin McKenzie, Tom Felton When a new porter forms an unlikely connection with the youngest daughter of the esteemed Davenport family, his arrival coincides with a disastrous wedding that threatens to unravel the family’s prim-and-proper façade. Think Downton Abbey meets The Favourite , with a twist. Jay Kelly (2025) Release Date: December 5, 2025 Director: Noah Baumbach Starring: George Clooney, Adam Sandler, Laura Dern Jay Kelly , the latest film from Academy Award nominee Noah Baumbach, follows famed movie star Jay Kelly (George Clooney) and his loyal manager Ron (Adam Sandler) on a press tour throughout Europe. Both men confront the choices that shaped their lives. Thoughtful, funny, and bittersweet, critics haave praised Baumbach for his newest feature. Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery (2025) Release Date: December 12, 2025 Director: Rian Johnson Starring: Cailee Spaeny, Glenn Close, Kerry Washington The Knives Out franchise welcomes a new mystery, starring Daniel Craig as the famous detective Benoit Blanc. While not much is known about the plot, this film has been titled as the detective’s most dangerous case yet. The film will also feature new faces, including Josh O’Connor. Ella McCay (2025) Release Date: December 12, 2025 Director: James L. Brooks Starring: Woody Harrelson, Ayo Edebiri, Jack Lowden Ella McCay will bring viewers to Rhode Island in this James Brooks film starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Emma Mackey, and Woody Harrelson. This comedy centers on a politician who becomes the Ocean State’s next governor and has to balance her new job and personal life. Avatar: Fire and Ash (2025) Release Date: December 19, 2025 Director: James Cameron Starring: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldaña, Sigourney Weaver, David Thewlis, Stephen Lang, Giovanni Ribisi, Michelle Yeoh, Oona Chaplin The third film of the Avatar franchise brings audiences back to Pandora and the Na’vi, this time with new biomes and new clans. The “Ash People” will represent fire and depict Na’vi who are not as kind as those we’ve seen before. New additions to the cast include Michelle Yeoh, playing human scientist Dr. Karina Mogue, and Oona Chaplin, playing the villain Na’vi Varang. Avatar 3 follows on the heels of the box office juggernaut Avatar: The Way of Water , and the first act of the fourth film has also already been shot. The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants (2025) Release Date: December 19, 2025 Director: Derek Drymon Starring: Tom Kenny, Clancy Brown, Brian Doyle-Murray, Bill Fagerbakke, Rodger Bumpass, Mr. Lawrence, Carolyn Lawrence SpongeBob SquarePants and friends are coming back to the big screen. The fourth movie centers on SpongeBob’s adventures in the deep sea, facing the ghost of the Flying Dutchman. The original SpongeBob SquarePants TV series has been running since 1999 and is currently in its 14th season. The Housemaid (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Paul Feig Starring: Sydney Sweeney, Amanda Seyfried, Brandon Sklenar, Michele Morrone Paul Feig’s latest film is a psychological thriller based on the 2022 novel of the same name by Freida McFadden. Sydney Sweeney stars as a struggling woman who finds work as a housemaid for an affluent couple (Amanda Seyfried and It Ends with Us ‘ Brandon Sklenar), only to discover her new employers may harbor some dark secrets. In other words, perfect Christmas Day viewing. Marty Supreme (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Josh Safdie Starring: Timothée Chalamet, Odessa A’zion, Gwyneth Paltrow Josh Safdie’s sports drama stars Timothée Chalamet as Marty Reisman, the renowned Table Tennis player who, at 22, won five bronze medals at the World Table Tennis Championships. Aside from his successful career, Reisman faced numerous tribulations throughout his life. Along will Chalamet, Odessa A’zion and Gwyneth Paltrow bring this story to life. Anaconda (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Tom Gormican Starring: Steve Zahn, Paul Rudd, Jack Black, Daniela Melchior, Thandiwe Newton, Selton Mello The giant man-eating snake returns to screens in this cheeky update of the 1997 film that starred Jennifer Lopez and Ice Cube. While the original was a horror movie, the 2025 version will flip the story on its head to retell it as a comedy while still honoring its horror roots. The Testament of Ann Lee (2025) Release Date: December 25, 2025 Director: Mona Fastvoid Starring: Amanda Seyfried, Thomasin McKenzie, Lewis Pullman Amanda Seyfried stars as Ann Lee, the founding leader of the Shaker Movement who was declared the female Christ by her followers. The film chronicles her creation of a utopian community defined by worship through song and dance. Already earning a Certified Fresh score of 90%, The Testament of Ann Lee is being hailed as one of the year’s most powerful historical dramas. TBD In The Grey (2025) Release Date: TBD Director: Guy Ritchie Starring: Jake Gyllenhaal, Henry Cavill, Eiza Gonzalez, Rosamund Pike, Fisher Stevens Jake Gyllenhaal, hot off Prime Video’s Road House , repurposes the tough-guy attitude in a new action thriller directed by Guy Ritchie. Gyllenhall previously starred in Ritchie’s war thriller, Guy Ritchie’s The Covenant , and will team up with Henry Cavill and Eiza Gonzalez, who reunite after Ritchie’s The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare . Together, the three form a gang of badasses determined to rescue billions stolen from them. January – November On an Apple device? Follow Rotten Tomatoes on Apple News. Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.title: James Gunn's DCU Just Unveiled Its Official Logos for 2026 Slate
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.snippet: James Gunn next to DCU movie tv slate logos. James Gunn's DCU recently debuted new logos for its biggest 2026 projects, Supergirl and Lanterns.As Lanterns won't premiere until late Summer 2026 , likely a few months after Supergirl, the two may have to split the spotlight for a period.
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.content: James Gunn's DCU Just Unveiled Its Official Logos for 2026 Slate MCU • Movies • TV • News • DC Universe • Star Wars • Interviews MCU MCU News Marvel Movies 2025 Release Dates Marvel TV Shows 2025 Release Dates Marvel Movie Watch Order Daredevil: Born Again Fantastic Four: First Steps Avengers: Doomsday Star Wars Star Wars News Andor (Season 2) DC Universe DC Movie News Superman (2025) The Batman 2 Movies Movie News Upcoming Movies Schedule TV Shows TV News Upcoming TV Show Schedule Disney+ Netflix Max Prime Video Hulu Paramount+ Peacock Interviews / Exclusives Culture Newsletter Podcast YouTube About About Us Contact Press Kit Ethics / Corrections Sitemap Account Search Home DCU James Gunn's DCU Just Unveiled Its Official Logos for 2026 Slate DC Studios just revealed brand new logos for its biggest 2026 releases. By Sam Hargrave Posted: December 16, 2025 James Gunn's DCU recently debuted new logos for its biggest 2026 projects, Supergirl and Lanterns . DC Studios officially began marketing Supergirl at CCXP with a special booth , laying the groundwork for its imminent first trailer. In doing so, the DCU is finally on the road to its next big release in six months' time with Supergirl , which hits theaters on June 26, 2026. That will be followed later in the year with Lanterns ' HBO premiere in late summer and Clayface , which will bring its unique blend of Gotham City body horror to screens on September 11, 2026. As Warner Bros. and DC Studios begin to rev the hype engine for Supergirl , an official new logo for the June 2026 blockbuster was released online. The Kingdom Come-inspired design will be familiar to the many who caught Superman this year, with a unique shimmering coming from the text to hint at its galactic setting. DC Studios The home of the DCU also offered an alternate logo for Supergirl with a more neon, retro aesthetic, a bigger departure from James Gunn's Superman . DC Studios As the Super-Family famously wears their mutual House of El symbol across their chests, Supergirl 's logo is mostly the same as Superman 's. Still, the crest received some minor updates, such as replacing the yellow bevel with black, possibly signalling Kara Zor-El's darker personality compared to her hopeful cousin. DC Studios DC Studios may use both Supergirl logos over the coming months as part of its marketing campaign, possibly highlighting her varied personality. That said, the Superman -esque design looks to be the movie's primary logo. DC Studios Supergirl will fly into theaters on June 26, 2026, directed by Craig Gillespie with a script from Ana Nogueira, based on the Woman of Tomorrow comics. The DCU blockbuster will star Milly Alcock's Supergirl, Eve Ridley's Ruthye, Jason Momoa's Lobo, and Matthias Schoenaerts' Krem of the Yellow Hills. Next up after that will be Lanterns , which also recently received an updated logo with distinct differences from the one worn by Nathan Fillion's Guy Gardner (who will appear in the HBO series) in this summer's Superman . DC Studios Some fans are convinced that the swirls hidden in Lanterns ' new logo are hinting at a major Justice League villain . Some have theorized that the sci-fi mystery series may introduce the Centre, given James Gunn's previous promise that Lanterns will be integral to setting up the DCU's larger storyline. DC Studios The logo itself differs greatly to the one featured in 2011's Green Lantern , utilising a more bluish-green hue and not including the full outer circle. DC Lanterns enthusiasts got a brief look at what series stars Kyle Chandler and Aaron Pierre will look like suited up as Hal Jordan and John Stewart, respectively, for the eight-episode True Detective -inspired series via an HBO featurette. Also included in the teaser was a look at the show's text logo. DC The text uses a relatively standard sans-serif font and appears perhaps a bit less flashy than past logos associated with Green Lantern. The 2011 movie featured a font that evoked a sci-fi aesthetic, whereas Green Lantern: The Animated Series used a more over-the-top lettering with vibrant colors. DC Despite recently delaying the series' premiere into late summer, fans are hopeful that more news will be imminent after a trailer description revealed a fourth Green Lantern who will appear after footage was shown to select press and audiences. DC Clayface still hasn't launched its marketing campaign and may not until the spring ahead of its September 11, 2026, but the logo for the Batman villain spin-off was revealed on set . The DCU body horror was crafted by Mike Flanagan and directed by James Watkins, with Tom Rhys Harries stepping into the leading role. The DCU's Global Takeover Is Just Beginning, And I Can't Wait For now, DC Studios seems to want all eyes on Supergirl , going as far as to place a countdown in Times Square, New York City, to promote its first trailer. Fans saw over the summer that Warner Bros. pulled out all the stops to market Superman globally, and they may be hoping to carry that momentum forward into Supergirl . As Lanterns won't premiere until late Summer 2026, likely a few months after Supergirl , the two may have to split the spotlight for a period. However, complete focus may not shift to the HBO series until July and beyond, once Supergirl has been and gone, hopefully driving interest in the DCU to new heights. Of course, amongst the chaos, DC Studios is sure to put a bold push on Clayface in the hopes of attracting horror, non-superhero audiences to the DCU. With all three projects potentially having some period of overlapping marketing, 2026 could be a huge year for DC, dragging the blue brand back into the public eye. Currently, it appears that DC Studios' 2026 offerings will be limited to just those three live-action projects (two movies and one HBO series). It's possible that slate could be complemented with an animated offering later in the year ( such as the Blue Beetle sequel series ), but that remains unconfirmed for now. Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.title: All 3 Of 2025’s $1B+ Movies Have One Big Thing In Common
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.snippet: Only three 2025 movies have had box office results of over $1 billion so far - though all of these movies have one other thing in common.
Upcoming blockbuster movies to watch in.content: All 3 Of 2025’s $1B+ Movies Have One Big Thing In Common Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie Features Movie News Movie Reviews Movie Lists Movie Trailers TV Submenu TV Features TV News TV Reviews Network TV TV Lists Reality TV Submenu Reality TV Features Reality TV News Reality TV Lists Gaming Submenu Game Features Game News Game Guides Game Reviews Game Lists Comics Submenu Comic Features Comic News Comic Reviews Comic Lists Anime Submenu Anime Features Anime News Anime Lists Music Submenu Music Features Music Lists Network TV Schedule Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Podcasts Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards Christmas Advent Calendar Exclusives Best on Streaming SR Database Network TV Schedule Close All 3 Of 2025’s $1B+ Movies Have One Big Thing In Common Stitch looking up in the 2025 Lilo & Stitch By Zoe Miskelly Published 23 hours ago Zoë Miskelly is an editor for Screen Rant's Superheroes team, and has covered Marvel, DC, and other superhero franchises in comic, movie, and show form for 8 years. Zoë's love of superheroes and all things Marvel & DC started out in childhood, and has blossomed into a career getting to talk about some of the biggest and best movies and shows of all time, having previously focused on comics while working at WhatCulture. Sign in to your ScreenRant account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap All of the three 2025 movies that currently have a box office result of $1 billion or more all have the same origins, making their shared success this year even more noteworthy. The past few years have seen many movies cross the $1 billion threshold when it comes to their worldwide box office, with some releases seeming basically destined for this result, and some surprise successes netting this amount to keep things interesting. 2025 has been no exception, as multiple films have achieved this major milestone with their theatrical results, showing that movies can still enjoy immense theatrical success, even in an era where streaming is in many ways bigger than ever. Interestingly, 2025's current $1B+ movies all share one key thing in common, proving the potential of one often underappreciated corner of the world of cinema. 2025's 3 $1B+ Movies Are All Follow-Ups To Animated Movies Nick and Judy rowing a boat in Zootopia 2 © Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures / Courtesy Everett Collection Though 2025's biggest box office hits are different in many other regards, the three films in question all share an origin of sorts, as they're all follow-ups to animated movies - with Ne Zha 2 having made $2 billion with its worldwide box office, Zootopia 2 having just become 2025's second-highest grossing movie of 2025 by reaching the $1.1 billion mark, and Lilo & Stitch coming in third for the year with its own $1 billion results. Of course, it's worth noting that, while Ne Zha 2 and Zootopia 2 are animated movies themselves that serve as direct sequels to the stories they follow up on, Lilo & Stitch is a live-action remake of the original 2002 animated Disney movie. However, all three still ultimately follow up on the original animated movies their respective series began with - which is interesting to note, even though this trend may be broken by 2025's next possible $1B movie. 2025's $1B Movie Rule May Be Broken In The Final Days Of The Year Closeup of Kiri (Sigourney Weaver) in Avatar: Fire & Ash Though 2025 is in its final days, there are still some major movies on the way for the year - and the film that looks set to be the biggest of this time period is, of course, that of the third Avatar movie, Avatar: Fire and Ash . With both previous Avatar movies having garnered well over $2 billion, it stands to reason that the third film will at absolute worst come close to these previous results, adding it to 2025's $1B+ movie roster. This would make it the outlier among 2025's existing movies that have broken the $1 billion box office mark, which is notable both in that it would show animated movie follow-ups weren't the only films that were capable of reaching this milestone in 2025 , and in that it would further reflect how impressive these $1 billion results were, since their only box office peer would be the next installment in a $5 billion movie series. Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: Dec 8, 2025 · The limitless possibilities of sci-fi stories go some way to explain why the genre also tends to consistently be one of the most popular and sought after when it comes to theatrically released films. Indeed, based on 2026 's sci-fi movie lineup, it seems the year is set to be rife with criticial and commercial hits within this realm.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie Features Movie News Movie Reviews Movie Lists Movie Trailers TV Submenu TV Features TV News TV Reviews Network TV TV Lists Reality TV Submenu Reality TV Features Reality TV News Reality TV Lists Gaming Submenu Game Features Game News Game Guides Game Reviews Game Lists Comics Submenu Comic Features Comic News Comic Reviews Comic Lists Anime Submenu Anime Features Anime News Anime Lists Music Submenu Music Features Music Lists Network TV Schedule Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Podcasts Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards Christmas Advent Calendar Exclusives Best on Streaming SR Database Network TV Schedule Close 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype Din Djarin and Grogu sitting in the cockpit of an N-1 Starfighter in The Mandalorian By Zoe Miskelly Published Dec 8, 2025 Zoë Miskelly is an editor for Screen Rant's Superheroes team, and has covered Marvel, DC, and other superhero franchises in comic, movie, and show form for 8 years. Zoë's love of superheroes and all things Marvel & DC started out in childhood, and has blossomed into a career getting to talk about some of the biggest and best movies and shows of all time, having previously focused on comics while working at WhatCulture. Sign in to your ScreenRant account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2026 is scheduled to have a considerable range of monumentally exciting sci-fi movies released within it - though some of these films have more hype built up for them than others for at least the time being. Historically, sci-fi is a genre that can be explored in an astronomical assortment of ways - from gritty and grueling dystopian tales, to remarkably light-hearted romps through futuristic lands and concepts. The limitless possibilities of sci-fi stories go some way to explain why the genre also tends to consistently be one of the most popular and sought after when it comes to theatrically released films. Indeed, based on 2026's sci-fi movie lineup, it seems the year is set to be rife with criticial and commercial hits within this realm. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die Sam Rockwell faces the camera in Good Luck Have Fun Don't Die While those lucky enough to attend the 2025 Fantastic Fest did garner an opportunity to watch a preview screening of sci-fi comedy Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die , the movie's full theatrical release is set to take place on February 13, 2026 , making it one of the first sci-fi films to release in the year. Based on Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die 's trailer - and strikingly solid 94% Rotten Tomatoes reviews from those who saw it early - it seems the film will be helping kick off the year in suitably stellar fashion. With a time travel premise that sees an unlucky inhabitant of a dystopian future journey back in time to try and save the world from its fate - recruiting a selection of seemingly random people from an LA diner in the hopes of creating a team that can protect humanity - it's clear Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die will be as entertaining as it is visually striking, making it an early must-watch for 2026. Flowervale Street Flowervale Street poster The mystery around Flowervale Street has worked in its favor in some ways when it comes to building hype around it from those who are aware of its existence. However, the relative lack of information we have about the movie does mean the main excitement around the film comes from the names that are currently attached to it, which include J.J. Abrams being one of the film's producers, and Anne Hathaway and Ewan McGregor being some of the main actors involved. Thus far, what's been teased for Flowervale Street seems to promise an exciting story, complete with at least one dinosaur and a street that's being affected by sci-fi phenomena, altering the lives of lead characters the Platt family forever - though more specifics about this installment will seemingly only become clearer closer to its scheduled August 14 release date . The Dog Stars The Dog Stars book cover Ridley Scott's history in the sci-fi genre is impossible to miss, with the likes of Alien , Blade Runner , and later The Martian cementing his reputation as someone who is able to give futuristic worlds and larger-than-life stories a grounded edge that makes them truly gripping throughout. As such, it's no surprise Scott's next sci-fi film, The Dog Stars , is one many are very excited to see release on March 27 . This is doubly true given the movie is adapting a book of the same name, which promises a suitably soulful and dramatic story of a man, his dog, and the gunman they befriended existing in a post-apocalyptic world, before one radio transmission sends the protagonists on an unexpected mission. Steven Spielberg's 2026 Movie Steven Spielberg at the London Premiere of The Thursday Murder Club John Rainford/Cover Images With Steven Spielberg being one of the biggest names in the directing sphere still decades into his career, his impending 2026 sci-fi release is naturally one that has a lot of intrigue and excitement around it - particularly since it appears details about the film may be being kept secret for as long as possible, given the name of the movie still isn't known, though its release is schedule for only months away on June 12, 2026 . Set to feature a range of talented actors - including Colman Domingo, Wyatt Russell, Emily Blunt and Colin Firth - Steven Spielberg's movie is reportedly based on an original idea from the director, and will be the first movie he's directed to hit cinemas since 2022's The Fabelmans . As such, there seems to be plenty of reasons to be excited about the film, even if we know little other than the fact it doesn't seem Steven Spielberg's sci-fi film is set to play in IMAX in 2026. Project Hail Mary Ryan Gosling in Project Hail Mary Combining a sci-fi story that is in many ways inherently suited to a big-screen adaptation - as is the case for Andy Weir's 2021 book Project Hail Mary - and some talented actors and directors seems a recipe built for success. As such, it's worth noting that Project Hail Mary is directed by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller - who may be most recognizable as the directors of the Spider-Verse films - and has Ryan Gosling play the movie's lead character, which all seems to suggest the film could well become one of the bigger movies of 2026 when it releases on March 20 . Project Hail Mary centers around Ryland Grace, a scientist whose primary challenge in the story comes when he finds himself on a space mission with no memory of who he is or what he was striving to do. Grace soon encounters an alien lifeform who becomes his main companion in this complex set of circumstances, with their dynamic unfolding into a truly emotional story about two very different worlds. Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping The Hunger Games has seen a resurgence in popularity thanks to 2023's The Hunger Games: A Ballad Of Songbirds And Snakes , which itself built hype for fellow Hunger Games prequel Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping - a film that is set to release on November 20, 2026 . Sunrise On The Reaping covers the story of Katniss' mentor, Haymitch Abernathy, and what his first Hunger Games was like - with the original books and movies providing some details regarding this matter, but leaving much of the 50th annual Hunger Games otherwise a mystery. Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping 's trailer has already demonstrated how the film will balance the action and tragedies that make the series so gripping, while also delving further into the history of both Haymitch himself, and the world of Panem, shedding more light on the events of the main timeline. Supergirl Milly Alcock as Supergirl in the Superman movie While there have been a fair number of live-action DC movies over the years, the films often veer away from showing the further reaches of the comic universe, instead focusing more squarely on Earth and the events that take place on it. This makes it all the more exciting that Supergirl seems set to do just the opposite with its story, since it looks to adapt the comic run of Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow, which takes place almost entirely on a range of different alien planets that are much unlike our own in many ways. Not only does this ensure Supergirl gets a more directly sci-fi-esque story - unlike Kal-El's adventures in the DCU's first movie, Superman - it also means the DC Universe's further corners can be fleshed out as early as its second film thanks to Supergirl 's June 26, 2026 release date , which has major implications for the wider franchise, too. Dune 3 Timothée Chalamet as Paul Atreides in Dune 2 looking off-screen Sci-fi's favorite alien worm series is set to return once more with the movie reboot's third installment, which is scheduled to debut on December 18, 2026 , and take viewers back to the world of Arrakis as Paul Atreides tries to unite its people to fight against the threat of House Harkonnen, who seek to take over the planet and its valuable resources. Now the first two installments of this series have built up a solid audience for the films and their epic story of how the cosmos are changed by the family of House Atreides forever, it seems the third film has a prime opportunity to delve into some of the biggest events in the book series - and introduce some of the bigger moral questions and plot twists that the story has to offer. Thus far, the 2020s Dune series has done a striking job of translating the sprawling sci-fi worlds of the books to life - both in its visuals and in the acting of its cast of characters - and it seems things are likely to only continue to amp up in this vital chapter of the story in every regard, painting a decidedly thrilling picture of what's to come for the franchise. The Mandalorian And Grogu Grogu eating cookies in The Mandalorian Mentioning there's hype for an upcoming Star Wars movie is perhaps as obvious as saying water is wet, even though the decades-old sci-fi world has seen some more divided reception in the past few years - which naturally bodes well for The Mandalorian and Grogu when it releases on May 22, 2026 . The Mandalorian and Grogu focusing on two of the most beloved new characters from the franchise's recent years should go some way to convince even those who have not been as keen on Star Wars' newer directions to give the film a chance, which suggests the already staggering brand appeal at play here can be capitalized on even further. With the opportunity to be a space-faring action-packed adventure, a follow-up on the aftermath of some of the biggest events in Star Wars' timeline, and a tale of an unusual found family finding their place in the galaxy, Din Djarin and Grogu's film story should theoretically have a little of something for every kind of Star Wars fan, and then some. Avengers: Doomsday Fantastic Four First Steps Post-Credits scene of Franklin Richards and Doctor Doom The sheer scope and scale teased for Avengers: Doomsday means it's inherently the biggest sci-fi movie of 2026 in terms of hype, even though the MCU has, much like Star Wars, had some more divided reception in recent months and years. The MCU has grown bigger and bigger over the course of its almost two-decade-long run, both in terms of the size of its world and stories, and in terms of its reputation. Doomsday will be the first Avengers movie since the genre-defining success of Avengers: Endgame - which sets a high bar for film in terms of what is possible for it when it releases on December 18, 2026 , but also ensures that a monumental amount of people are eagerly awaiting what this next chapter of the Avengers series holds, even if some may have their doubts about what might come next. With this next part of the MCU bringing back several major figures for the franchise - including many big Fox X-Men actors, and of course the return of Robert Downey Jr, this time playing Doctor Doom - the stage is set for a truly colossal story that pays tribute to not just every part of the MCU that came before it, but also to the wider Marvel movie world, thanks to the franchise's recent sci-fi forays into the concept of the multiverse. Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 - WhatCulture
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: Dec 8, 2025 · A rundown of the biggest and most hotly anticipated sci-fi features coming next year.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content:
20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 WhatCulture About Team Advertise Contact Videos Quizzes Youtube Facebook Twitter Videos Search Film Home WWE TV Gaming Comics Music Offbeat Quizzes Comps Sport UFC Sign In Youtube Facebook Twitter Film WWE TV Gaming Comics Music Offbeat Quizzes More Search User menu 20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 A rundown of the biggest and most hotly anticipated sci-fi features coming next year. by Alisdair Hodgson Dec 8, 2025 December 8th, 2025 Disney 2025 has dished up a plethora of intriguing and excellent science
fiction films, from Denis Villeneuve's blockbuster epic Dune: Part Two, to
Yorgos Lanthimos' hillbilly conspiracy thriller Bugonia. And all this sets our
sights high for the coming year. Lucky, then, the studios and directors we
have given our time and money to will be delivering exactly what we want. Steven Spielberg returns to the broader genre for the first time
since 2018’s Ready Player One, and to alien films specifically since 2008’s
Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull. Ridley Scott is also
dusting off his lenses for an adaptation of Peter Heller’s The Dog Stars. Marvel fans who have felt let down by the middling films the
superhero giant has put out this decade have a new Spider-Man and Avengers
to look forward to, and DC die-hards get to see Supergirl finally take the
limelight on screen again after decades spent MIA. Other big franchises getting another chance to shine include
The Hunger Games, Mortal Kombat, and The Mandalorian (in its silver screen
debut), but there is also plenty for the indie crowd, with Maggie Gyllenhaal’s gangster
monster movie The Bride!, and Na Hong-jin’s alien thriller Hope - his first multinational
feature. It’s a full roster, and suffice to say, the following 20 movies are certain to become your most anticipated sci-fi films of 2026, if they’re not
already. 20. The Dresden Sun VMI Worldwide UK release date: February (day TBC) Science fiction fans who are hoping The Dresden Sun might be
an adaptation of Kurt Vonnegut’s Slaughterhouse 5 will be sorely disappointed
(our day will come!), but for everyone else, Michael Ryan’s upcoming picture
promises an exciting new entry in a rather niche genre: the sci-fi heist
movie. The film features converging narratives which see an expert mercenary
work an inside job to steal a big corporation’s most valued asset, while an
insurance analyst is caught in a web of corporate rivals and fraud, ending up
on the run from a military contractor. The first look trailer and those few
images available of The Dresden Sun so far suggest a high-tech, neon, Blade Runner
aesthetic paired with a modern corporate espionage crime thriller’s steely
edge. It definitely doesn’t have anything like the budget of many
of the other sci-fi flicks heading our way next year, but it’s got an
intriguing cast in Christina Ricci, Steven Ogg (Trevor from GTA V), and Mena
Suvari, and looks like it’s going to be a solid streaming watch. Next In this post: Sci-Fi films Science Fiction Movies Avengers: Doomsday 21st Century Sci-fi 2026 Movies The Mandalorian & Grogu Dune Part Three The Dresden Sun Posted On: 8th Dec 2025 Contributor Alisdair Hodgson Writer, editor, trend-setter. Slayer of gnomes and trolls.

Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 | Film Stories
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: 2 days ago · The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed with genre films from some of the world’s most respected filmmakers: the last time we had Steven Spielberg and Ridley Scott release a sci-fi ...
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 | Film Stories Skip to the content Search Menu Search for: Submit News Features Reviews TV Gaming Podcasts All Episodes Store Live Events Subscriptions Magazines Digital Buy Digital Articles Login Magazine Film Stories Junior Subscription Deals Contact Us Feature News 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 by Ryan Lambie | December 15, 2025 2026 sci-fi Share this Article: Killer robots, brain-controlling diseases, UFOs and more: here’s our pick of 15 sci-fi films coming up in 2026… The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed ... 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 Killer robots, brain-controlling diseases, UFOs and more: here’s our pick of 15 sci-fi films coming up in 2026… The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed with genre films from some of the world’s most respected filmmakers: the last time we had Steven Spielberg and Ridley Scott release a sci-fi movie in the same year was in 1982. With apologies to any superhero movies that might happen to contain sci-fi elements (no Supergirl or Avengers: Doomsday here), please enjoy this list of the most exciting genre films coming up next year. Big budgets, small budgets, comedy elements, splashes of horror – there really is something for just about everyone in the list below. Let’s begin, then, with a cautionary tale about indulging in carnal relations with a household appliance… Soulm8te – 9th January (or perhaps not…) A shot from M3GAN 2.0. No official imagery available for Soulm8te at the time of writing, readers. Credit: Universal The year gets off to a rather saucy start with this spin-off from Blumhouse’s killer robot thriller, M3GAN. Soulm8te is said to be taking the franchise into erotic territory, as a lonely widower buys a gynoid to keep him company – only for the wretched thing to start wreaking havoc. Directed by Kate Dolan and starring David Rysdahl and Lily Sullivan, it sounds like similar territory to Subservience , a 2024 thriller starring Megan Fox, and numerous other films where human-robot relations turn sour. Will it be a bigger hit than M3GAN 2.0 , which was an unexpected disappointment in 2025? Dunno m8. (Since this post was written, Universal has reportedly taken Soulm8te off its 2026 calendar, and is now shopping it to other distributors. We haven’t seen any official confirmation of this as yet, but we’ll update this list if we do.) Bulk – January and February Noah Taylor on restrained form in Bulk. Credit: Film Four. British director Ben Wheatley’s career has spanned indie drama and horror ( Down Terrace, Kill List ) and expensive thrillers ( Rebecca, Meg 2: The Trench ). Bulk sees the filmmaker explore mind-bending science fiction, albeit in a uniquely DIY fashion. Shot on a tiny budget on domestic cameras (iPhones, SVHS and the like), Bulk sees protagonist Corey Harlan (Sam Riley) head off into a bizarre, dimension-spanning odyssey that includes an enigmatic scientist (Alexandra Maria Lara) and a variety of eccentric characters played by Noah Taylor. That Harlan’s odyssey takes place almost entirely in a single nondescript house doesn’t make it any less epic. Touring UK cinemas large and small in early 2026 , Bulk is possibly the most mesmerising, unusual genre films you’ll see all year. You certainly won’t forget it in a hurry. 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple – 14th January Ralph Fiennes holds his temple in 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple. Credit: Sony. Director Nia DaCosta takes over from Danny Boyle for the next chapter in a planned 28 Years trilogy, and by all accounts, this one’s an absolute corker. Picking up the thread from 2025’s sequel, it’s another journey into a country riven by superstition, disease and territorialism. We do wonder where screenwriter Alex Garland gets his out-there ideas from. Mercy – 23rd January We’ll try to go into this one with an open mind. It’s the latest film from director Timur Bekmambetov, previously known for the flashy action thriller, Wanted , but more recently associated with a series of ‘screenlife’ thrillers. He was producer on War Of The Worlds – a version of HG Wells’ invasion text viewed entirely through a computer interface. Starring Ice Cube and a supporting cast of Amazon goods and services, it was one of the most bafflingly misguided films of 2025 . But anyway: Mercy . Starring Chris Pratt, it’s set in a Minority Report -esque future where the entire legal system has been handed over to AI. Chris Pratt plays a detective who’s accused of murdering his own wife, and has 90 minutes to convince an icy digital judge (Rebecca Ferguson) of his innocence – or face summary execution. The perplexing thing about Mercy isn’t so much the premise as the venue; Amazon MGM’s giving it a big cinema push, including a run on 3D IMAX screens. The trailer dresses the film up a bit, but it’s still mostly a single-location thriller with plot points unfolding on computer screens. We’re not sure it screams big-screen, bring-your-chums entertainment – but again, we’ll keep an open mind. Suggested product Film Stories "I Try Not To Do Snark..." Tee Merch £22.99 Suggested product Nicolas Cage Appreciation Coasters Merch £12.99 Cold Storage – 13th February 2026 The Last Of Us played for laughs? Quite possibly. A storage facility becomes overrun by a mind-controlling fungus in a sci-fi comedy written by David Koepp – adapted from his own novel – and directed by Jonny Campbell ( Alien Autopsy ). Georgina Campbell ( Barbarian ) and Joe Keery ( Stranger Things ) star, and there’s a role too for Liam Neeson, who’s made some, er, interesting career choices of late. That’s hardly the film’s fault, though. The trailer is filled with gore and sweary, gross-out humour, and it all looks tremendously entertaining. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die – 20th February Another sci-fi comedy, Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die marks the return of director Gore Verbinski ( Rango , the Pirates Of The Caribbean franchise). Sam Rockwell stars as a dishevelled, oddly-dressed man who stumbles into a diner one night insisting that he’s from the future – and that he needs the customers’ help to avert a future war against machines. The film made its debut at 2025’s Fantastic Fest, where it garnered almost universally positive reviews. The supporting cast includes Zazie Beetz, Michael Pena and Juno Temple. We can’t wait. In The Blink Of An Eye – 27th February We were a bit worried about this film for a while. Finished in March 2025 , In The Blink Of An Eye sat without a release date for several months, with rumours of reshoots doing the rounds. The sci-fi drama is now making its premiere at the Sundance Film Festival, meaning it’ll screen there between late January and the 1st February. From Wall-E and John Carter director Andrew Stanton, In The Blink Of An Eye is an epoch-spanning fable that takes us from humanity’s earliest days to a spacecraft 200 years in the future. The script, by Colby Day, was on the Black List of best unproduced screenplays in 2016, and it’s a terrific read : seamlessly eliding between eras and characters at various points in history, all building to a truly emotional climax. Day also wrote Spaceman, an Adam Sandler sci-fi you can find on Netflix; In The Blink Of An Eye promises to be another terrific genre piece. (Unfortunately, In The Blink Of An Eye doesn’t appear to be getting a cinema release after its festival debut; instead, Disney has opted to send it directly to its Hulu screening service on the 27th February.) The Bride! – 26th March Not connected to Guillermo del Toro’s baroque take on Frankenstein made for Netflix, The Bride is the latest film from actor turned director Maggie Gyllenhaal. It stars Jessie Buckley as a mortally injured woman revived by Anette Bening’s Dr Euphronius, while Christian Bale plays the monster and the Bride’s betrothed. Moving Mary Shelley’s Gothic novel into the roaring (19)20s, it looks like a sumptuous and beautifully-designed tragic romance. Project Hail Mary – 20th March Based on the novel by Andy Weir, Project Hail Mary sees Ryan Gosling’s unassuming science teacher blasted into space in a last-ditch effort to save humanity. The trailer gave away a bit more of the book’s events than we were expecting, so maybe avoid that if you want to go into the cinema completely cold. The adaptation’s by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, so expect plenty of humour and heart as well as Weir’s plausibly detailed science fiction. In a case of unfortunate cosmic timing, Project Hail Mary places it rather near another major sci-fi film from a director whose last big hit was also a Weir adaptation… The Dog Stars – 27th March There aren’t any images for The Dog Stars kicking around yet, so please accept this still from 1980s children’s TV show, Children Of The Dog Star. We used to quite like it. Some of Ridley Scott’s most beloved and influential movies are in the sci-fi genre – Alien, Blade Runner and The Martian (the Weir adaptation we were on about above) are all markedly different in tone, but all classics in their own way. We’re excited to see what Scott’s done with The Dog Stars, then: adapted from Peter Heller’s novel, it’s set in a future world ravaged by a pandemic. Holed up in an aircraft hangar, the two protagonists – Jacog Elordi’s pilot, Hig and Josh Brolin’s sniper, Bangley – are coaxed back into the open world by a mysterious signal. Margaret Qualley, Guy Pearce and Benedict Wong also star. Given Scott’s visual flair – even his uneven Alien prequels were often lovely to look at – this is arguably one of our most anticipated genre films of the year. The Mandalorian And Grogu – 22nd May Lucasfilm’s first Star Wars movie in seven years, The Mandalorian And Grogu takes the hit Disney+ series out for a big screen spin-off – making it the Holiday On The Buses of space fantasies. We don’t know much about the plot, and frankly, we don’t need to know: as long as director Jon Favreau delivers on the pace and spectacle, we should be in for a pulpy, entertaining evening at the pictures. Pedro Pascal, Grogu, Sigourney Weaver and Jeremy Allan White all star – the latter as the alarmingly buff son of the late Jabba. Disclosure Day – 12th June It’s an absurdly stuffed year for respected directors making genre films. And Disclosure Day could be the biggest of the lot: it’s the latest from Steven Spielberg, and a return to the UFO-based subject matter of Close Encounters Of The Third Kind. It’s written by David Koepp (see Cold Storage earlier), who previously worked with Spielberg on the adapted screenplay for Jurassic Park, and following the autobiographical drama of The Fabelmans , it’s a return to the summer blockbuster experience the filmmaker essentially invented. Emily Blunt, Josh O’Connor and Wyatt Russell star; it’s about an attempt to reveal the truth about alien intelligence to the world, and a shadowy attempt to stop it. We think. The trailer’s big on intrigue and low on plot specifics. It compels us, though. Flowervale Street – 10th August A generic picture of a dinosaur, courtesy of Public Domain Pictures. It Follows was one of the great horror movies of the 2010s, and here comes its director, David Robert Mitchell, with some sort of time-travelling IMAX thriller involving dinosaurs. Ewen McGregor and Anne Hathaway are the starriest names among the warm-blooded cast. At present, we don’t know a whole lot more about this one, either, but Mitchell is a hugely talented director of both comedy and suspense. His previous film, Under Silver Lake , was an unfairly overlooked commercial disappointment, but we thought it was an absolute keeper. As such, we’ve high hopes for Flowervale Street . Bring on the dinosaurs. The Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping – 20th November Quentin Tarantino’s favourite killer contest franchise is back with another prequel, this one joining things up to the 2011 film that started it all. Hence why Jennifer Lawrence and Josh Hutcherson are making a return as Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark. Expect more oppression, death and romance; Francis Lawrence has become a dab hand at making these. And as The Long Walk proved, he’s quite an underrated director, both technically and in the performances he gets from his actors. Dune: Part Three – 18th December An epic moment of epicness in Dune: Part Two. Credit: Warner Bros. The year ends with a pinch of spice courtesy of director Denis Villeneuve. Timothee Chalamet, Zendaya and the rest of the Dune crew are back for a third visit to Arrakis, and given that this chapter will sail beyond the confines of Frank Herbert’s original novel, which formed the basis for the first two movies, it’ll be fascinating to see where the Canadian filmmaker takes the saga next. Herbert’s own follow-up, Dune Messiah, had some truly wild ideas that might not translate too well onto a cinema screen, but Villeneuve’s previous adaptations were spectacularly done. Also coming up, with no release date attached: Ray Gunn, the animated sci-fi noir passion project from Brad Bird; Godzilla Minus Zero, the follow-up to instant kaiju klassic, Godzilla Minus One .
