Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: The Rip ( 2026 ). Release Date: January 16, 2026 Director: Joe Carnahan Starring: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck.Trust among the team of cops begins to fray as outside forces learn about the size of the seizure. Everything is called into question in one of 2026 ’s most anticipated Netflix films.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2026							 | 	Rotten Tomatoes About Rotten Tomatoes® Critics Home Box Office TV DVD MORE News Movies TV Shows RT App News Showtimes Trending on RT Home TV & Streaming Shows Best & Popular Upcoming in 2025 Watch for Free Holiday Movies & Streaming News The Most Anticipated Movies of 2026 The year is flush with the usual blockbuster franchise titles, but we've also got some thrilling genre fare and new projects from the likes of Steven Spielberg, Christopher Nolan, and Jordan Peele, among others. by Amrita Vora | November 12, 2025							| Comments TAGGED AS: movies Based on what we know so far, 2026 is shaping up to be pretty great, with a healthy mix of the expected blockbuster franchise titles, enticing genre films, and new projects from the likes of Steven Spielberg, Christopher Nolan, and Jordan Peele. With that in mind, here’s a handy calendar of some of the most noteworthy titles coming in 2026 so you can budget and plan accordingly. Recommended: The Most Anticipated Movies of 2025 Recommended: The Best Movies of 2025 JANUARY Soulm8te (2026) Release Date: January 2, 2026 Director: Kate Dolan Starring: Claudia Doumit , Lily Sullivan , David Rysdahl Blumhouse’s latest film about terrifying toys is Soulm8te , releasing early 2026. This spin-off of M3GAN sees a humanlike AI doll (Lily Sullivan) strike up a connection with David Rysdahl’s lonely character after his wife’s passing.  The film is helmed by director Kate Dolan and co-produced by horror maestro James Wan , the creator of the famous Insidious and Conjuring franchises. The Boys’ Claudia Doumit also joins the film, although her role remains under wraps. Greenland 2: Migration (2026) Release Date: January 9, 2026 Director: Ric Roman Waugh Starring: Gerard Butler , Morena Baccarin , Roman Griffith Davis Lionsgate has officially slated Greenland 2: Migration for release on January 9, 2026, marking the return of Gerard Butler and Morena Baccarin the post-apocalyptic survival saga. Directed by Ric Roman Waugh and written by Mitchell LaFortune and Chris Sparling, the sequel picks up after the events of the 2020 hit Greenland , which followed the Garrity family’s desperate race for shelter as a comet threatened to wipe out life on Earth. In Migration , we will follow the family as they emerge from their bunker in Greenland to navigate a devastated world in search of a new home. 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple (2026) Release Date: January 16, 2026 Director: Nia DaCosta Starring: Ralph Fiennes , Alfie Williams , Jack O’Connell 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple follows the 2025 sequel 28 Years Later , set decades after Cillian Murphy’s original 2002 horror film. The Marvels director Nia DaCosta is helming this project, while Murphy plays a behind-the-scenes role as a producer for the film. It is speculated that he might make a surprise appearance in the film, but that remains unconfirmed. The Rip (2026) Release Date: January 16, 2026 Director: Joe Carnahan Starring: Matt Damon , Ben Affleck Matt Damon and Ben Affleck shared a first look of their new crime thriller The Rip exclusively at Netflix’s TUDUM at the end of May 2025. The Rip centers around a team of Miami cops who discover millions in cash in a derelict stash house. Trust among the team of cops begins to fray as outside forces learn about the size of the seizure. Everything is called into question in one of 2026’s most anticipated Netflix films. Send Help (2026) Release Date: January 30, 2026 Director: Sam Raimi Starring: Rachel McAdams , Dylan O’Brien Send Help is an upcoming film directed by Sam Raimi, known for directing hit films such as Drag Me to Hell (2009). The film stars Rachel McAdams and Dylan O’Brien as two colleagues who become the sole survivors of a plane crash and are stranded on a deserted island. They must navigate their strained relationship and work together to survive. FEBRUARY GOAT (2026) Release Date: February 13, 2026 Director: Tyree Dillihay , Adam Rosette Starring: Caleb McLaughlin , Gabrielle Union , Stephen Curry The Golden State Warriors’ Stephen Curry, a four-time NBA champion, partners with Emmy-nominated director Tyree Dillihay and director Adam Rosette to produce an animated sports comedy titled GOAT , an underdog sports comedy. Sony Pictures has timed the release to celebrate the start of the 2026 All-Star Weekend in Los Angeles. Wuthering Heights (2026) Release Date: February 13, 2026 Director: Emerald Fennell Starring: Margot Robbie , Jacob Elordi This new adaptation of the Emily Bronte classic stars Saltburn’s Jacob Elordi and Barbie’s Margot Robbie, who is also a producer on the film, and, like the novel, centers around the tumultuous relationship between Catherine Earnshaw and Healthcliff, the orphan her father brought home as young boy. The Sheep Detectives (2026) Release Date: February 26, 2026 Directors: Kyla Balda Starring: Hugh Jackman , Emma Thompson , Nicholas Galitzine , Hong Chau , Nicholas Braun , Conleth Hill Hugh Jackman stars in this comedy as a shepherd who reads his sheep murder mystery stories every night before bed. Little does he know that once the lights are out, the sheep discuss the mysteries amongst themselves. Joining Hugh Jackman are Succession’ s Nicholas Braun and Game of Thrones ‘ Conleth Hill . Scream 7 (2026) Release Date: February 27, 2026 Director: Kevin Williamson Starring: Neve Campbell , Courteney Cox Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell) returns to face off against Ghostface once again, although this time, she’ll have to do it without the Carpenter sisters ( Melissa Barrera and Jenna Ortega ), who are not a part of the film. Kevin Williamson, who wrote Scream , Scream 2 , and Scream 4 , replaces the directing team of Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett, who helmed both previous entries. MARCH The Bride! (2026) Release Date: March 6, 2026 Director: Maggie Gyllenhaal Starring: Christian Bale , Jessie Buckley , Jake Gyllenhaal , Peter Sarsgaard , Annette Bening , Penelope Cruz , John Magaro A new Frankenstein film is being brought to life, this time through a female lens. In this remake by Maggie Gyllenhaal of 1935’s Bride of Frankenstein , a murdered young woman in 1930s Chicago is reborn again at the hands of Frankenstein (Christian Bale) and Dr. Euphronius. The Bride becomes not only Frankenstein’s romantic companion, but the subject of police scrutiny and the leader of a radical social movement. Hoppers (2026) Release Date: March 6, 2023 Director: Daniel Chong Starring: Jonn Hamm , Bobby Moynihan , Piper Curda The latest from Pixar follows an animal enthusiast named Mabel (Piper Curda) who, in an effort to communicate with animals, transfers her consciousness to a robot. Jon Hamm and SNL alum Bobby Moynihan have also joined the voice cast. Reminders of Him (2026) Release Date: March 13, 2026 Directors: Vanessa Caswill Starring: Tyriq Withers , Rudy Pankow , Maika Monroe Another Colleen Hoover adaption is coming to screens and this time it is Reminders of Him . After the release of It Ends With Us , it was no surprise that another novel was going to be adapted. Hoover herself will be leading the project, having co-written the screenplay. She is also a producer on the film. The Breadwinner Release Date: March 13, 2026 Director: Nate Bargatze Starring: Mandy Moore , Will Forte , Colin Jost , Kumail Nanjian Nate Bargatze’s feature film debut, which he’s writing, producing, and starring in, releases spring 2026. He is collaborating with Eric Appel, who helmed Weird: The Al Yankovic Story , and Dan Lagana, who co-wrote the script with him. The plot details still haven’t been revealed, but it will be interesting to see Bargartze’s transition from stand-up comedy to the big screen. Project Hail Mary (2026) Release Date: March 20, 2026 Director: Phil Lord , Christopher Miller Starring: Ryan Gosling , Sandra Hüller , Lionel Boyce Another high-stakes sci-fi adaptation is headed to the big screen, this time from bestselling author Andy Weir. Project Hail Mary stars Ryan Gosling as Ryland Grace, an astronaut who wakes up alone on a space station with no memory of who he is or why he’s there. As fragments of his memory return, he discovers he’s on a mission to the Tau Ceti solar system to stop a cosmic event that has already pushed Earth into the early stages of a new ice age. The film is directed by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller. APRIL The Super Mario Galaxy Movie (2026) Release Date: April 3, 2026 Director: Aaron Horvath , Michael Jelenic Starring: Chris Pratt , Anya Taylor-Joy , Charlie Day , Keegan-Michael Key , Jack Black Mario is heading to space… or so we think. Thanks to a teaser released during a September 2025 Nintendo Direct broadcast, we now know that the official title to the Super Mario Bros. Movie sequel will be The Super Mario Galaxy Movie , inspired by the eponymous Nintendo Wii title. We don’t know much else about the film other than the release date and the returning cast, so stay tuned for more details. Ready or Not 2: Here I Come (2026) Release Date: April 10, 2026 Directors: Matt Bettinelli-Olpin , Tyler Gillett Starring: Samara Weaving , Kathryn Newton Ready or Not 2 hits theaters on April 10, 2026, bringing back Samara Weaving as Grace for another round of chaos. The sequel to the 2019 hit promises even more shocking twists and a killer new cast. Directed by Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett. Michael (2026) Release Date: April 24, 2026 Director: Antoine Fuqua Starring: Jaafar Jackson, Nia Long, Colman Domingo, Laura Harrier, Larenz Tate Take out your red leather jackets and sequin-covered gloves and prepare to moonwalk into theaters and witness Antoine Fuqua’s Michael . Detailing the life of the man, myth, and music legend Michael Jackson (Jaafar Jackson), this biopic invites viewers to witness the personal woes that came along with the global success of the late hitmaker. With performances from Nia Long, Colman Domingo, Laura Harrier, and Larenz Tate, the story of the King of Pop is slated to grace big screens in April 2026. MAY Animal Friends (2026) Release Date: May 1, 2026 Director: Peter Atencio Starring: Ryan Reynolds , Aubrey Plaza , Jason Momoa , Vince Vaughn , Dan Levy , Addison Rae We don’t know much about the plot of this film, but we do know that it’s directed by Peter Atencio ( Keanu , The Machine ) and it’s a live-action/animated hybrid starring the likes of Ryan Reynolds, Aubrey Plaza, and Jason Momoa, among others. There are also presumably going to be animated animals involved, but we don’t yet know who will appear as themselves in the film, and who will be voicing animated characters. The Devil Wears Prada 2 (2026) Release Date: May 1, 2026 Director: David Frankel Starring: Anne Hathaway , Meryl Streep , Emily Blunt , Stanley Tucci , Kenneth Branagh Miranda Priestly and Andy Sachs are set to square off again, as Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep return to reprise their roles from the 2006 comedy. Based on the novel Revenge Wears Prada: The Devil Returns , the film will be directed by David Frankel, who helmed the first, with co-stars like Emily Blunt and Stanley Tucci returning. Disclosure (2026) Release Date: May 15, 2026 Director: Steven Spielberg Starring: Emily Blunt , Josh O’Connor , Colin Firth , Eve Hewson , Colman Domingo , Wyatt Russell Steven Spielberg reunites with David Koepp ( Jurassic Park , War of the Worlds ) for a new film based on an original idea from Spielberg. While we still don’t know much about the plot, we do know that it will be a sci-fi film about a UFO starring an A-list ensemble. Mortal Kombat II (2026) Release Date: May 15, 2026 Director: Simon McQuoid Starring: Hiroyuki Sanada, Lewis Tan, Jessica McNamee, Karl Urban, Tadanobu Asano, Mehcad Brooks The 2021 reboot of the video game adaptation Mortal Kombat wasn’t a huge hit with critics, but it earned enough of a following that it has now spawned a sequel. Lewis Tan (Cole Young), Jessica McNamee (Sonya), Mehcad Brooks (Jax), and Shogun co-stars Hiroyuki Sanada (Scorpion) and Tadanobu Asano (Raiden) all return to reprise their roles from the first film, while Karl Urban joins the cast as Johnny Cage. Star Wars: The Mandalorian and Grogu (2026) Release Date: May 22, 2026 Director: Jon Favreau Starring: Pedro Pascal , Jeremy Allen White , Sigourney Weaver In lieu of a fourth season of The Mandalorian , Disney and Lucasfilm have opted to give us The Mandalorian and Grogu , a standalone film that returns the Star Wars franchise back to theaters for the first time since J.J Abrams’ The Rise of Skywalker . Pedro Pascal reprises his iconic role as Din Djarin alongside everyone’s favorite little green force-wielder. Jeremy Allen White also stars in the film as Rotta the Hutt, the son of Jabba, and Sigourney Weaver makes an appearance in an as-yet undisclosed role. JUNE (Photo by ©Cannon Films/Courtesy Everett Collection) Masters of the Universe (2026) Release Date: June 5, 2026 Director: Travis Knight Starring: Alison Brie , Nicholas Galitzine , Camila Mendes After nearly 40 years, He-Man returns to the big screen in a new adaptation of Masters of the Universe . Nicholas Galitzine ( Red, White & Royal Blue ) stars as Prince Adam, who is marooned on Earth at age 10 and separated from his magical sword. As a grown-up, he fulfills his destiny as He-Man and battles for the fate of his home planet Eternia. The all-star cast includes Camila Mendes, Alison Brie, Idris Elba, and Jared Leto as He-Man’s nemesis Skeletor. (Photo by ©Dimension Films) Scary Movie 6 (2026) Release Date: June 12, 2026 Director: Michael Tiddes Starring: Marlon Wayans , Shawn Wayans , Dave Sheridan The Scary Movie franchise is back, with Shawn and Marlon Wayans teaming up with producer Neal H. Moritz to bring audiences more absurd pop culture and horror film references. Shawn, Marlon, and older brother Keenen Ivory co-wrote the film with Rick Alvarez, who worked with the Wayans brothers as far back as 2001’s Scary Movie 2 . Toy Story 5 (2026) Release Date: June 19, 2026 Director: Andrew Stanton Starring: Tim Allen , Blake Clark Remember when we all thought Toy Story 3 was the perfect swan song for Buzz and Woody? That was cute, wasn’t it? Fifteen years later, the dynamic duo are back in Toy Story 5 to face a new challenge when they realize that children are replacing their toys with gadgets and must spring into action. Details are scarce so far, but we do know the film is directed by Pixar vet Andrew Stanton ( Wall-E , Finding Nemo ) and we can expect much of the core voice cast, including Tom Hanks and Tim Allen, to return. Supergirl (2026) Release Date: June 26, 2026 Director: Craig Gillespie Starring: Milly Alcock , Eve Ridley , Matthias Schoenaerts , David Krumholtz , Emily Beecham House of the Dragon ‘ s Milly Alcock stars as Kara Zor-El (aka Supergirl) in an adaptation of the eponymous comic miniseries by Tom King that serves as the latest chapter of James Gunn and Peter Safran’s DC Universe. The story follows Supergirl as she travels the galaxy with Krypto the Superdog and helps a young woman in a quest for revenge. The film co-stars, Matthias Schoenaerts, Eve Ridley, David Krumholtz, and Emily Beecham. JULY (Photo by ©Universal Pictures) Minions 3: Mega Minions (2026) Release Date: July 1, 2026 Director: Pierre Coffin Starring: Brian Lynch Mega Minions was originally slated for a 2027 release but was pushed up by a year, replacing Shrek 5 ’ s release date. Steve Carell and Pierre Coffin reprise their roles as Gru and the minions, respectively, though little is known about the plot. Release Date: July 10, 2026 Director: Thomas Kail Starring: Catherine Laga’aia , Dwayne Johnson , Rena Owen , John Tui , Frankie Adams Moana is the latest Disney animated film to get the live-action remake treatment, courtesy of Tony Award-winning director Thomas Kail. Moana herself will be played by a fresh face in Catherine Laga’aia, while Dwayne Johnson returns to the role of Maui, who he voiced in the two animated films. (Photo by Universal) The Odyssey (2026) Release Date: July 17, 2026 Director: Christopher Nolan Starring: Matt Damon , Zendaya , Tom Holland , Anne Hathaway , Mia Goth , Charlize Theron , Jon Bernthal , Robert Pattinson Academy Award winner Christopher Nolan follows up Oppenheimer with an adaptation of Homer’s The Odyssey , which tells the story of Odysseus (Matt Damon) in the aftermath of the Trojan War. The film’s massive star-studded ensemble includes Robert Pattinson, Zendaya, Tom Holland, Anne Hathaway, Mia Goth, Charlize Theron, and more. (Photo by ©Sony Pictures Releasing/©Marvel Entertainment) Spider-Man: Brand New Day (2026) Release Date: July 31, 2026 Director: Destin Daniel Cretton Starring: Tom Holland Just two weeks after appearing in Christopher Nolan’s The Odyssey , Tom Holland is set to reprise his role as another famous literary character in Spider-Man: Brand New Day . Peter Parker’s next adventure will be penned by the No Way Home screenwriters Erik Sommers and Chris McKenna, with Shang-Chi director Destin Daniel Cretton at the helm. It’s unknown whether Zendaya and Jacob Batalon are involved, but it’s speculated that Tom Holland might make an appearance in Avengers: Doomsday earlier in the year. AUGUST Flowervale Street (2026) Release Date: August 14, 2026 Director: David Robert Mitchell Starring: Anne Hathaway , Ewan McGreggor, Maisy Stella From director David Robert Mitchell ( It Follows ) and producer J.J. Abrams comes a new sci-fi mystery starring Anne Hathaway, Ewan McGregor, Christian Convery, and Maisy Stella. The film was originally slated to release in 2025, but it was pushed back by almost a year after Final Destination: Bloodlines took over its original release date. (Photo by ©Paramount Pictures) PAW Patrol: The Dino Movie (2025) Release Date: August 14, 2026 Director: Cal Brunker Starring: McKenna Grace , Fortune Feimster , Jennifer Hudson The famous pups will be back for a third installment of Paw Patrol on the big screen. While the majority of the cast is not confirmed, McKenna Grace is reprising her role as Skye, and Joining her are Jennifer Hudson and Fortune Feimster , although their roles are currently undisclosed. Thread: An Insidious Tale (2026) Release Date: August 21, 2026 Director: Jeremy Slater Starring: Mandy Moore , Kumail Nanjiani Mandy Moore and Kumail Nanjiani are slated to star in the sixth installment of Blumhouse’s horror franchise Insidious . Garnering a collective $750 million in box office revenue worldwide, the Insidious movies center on otherworldly beings that seek to terrorize the world of the living, often resulting in gut-wrenching ramifications. Beginning in 2010, the film series has gained a cult-like following with the most recent installment, Insidious: The Red Door (2023) , scoring $189M worldwide at the box office. SEPTEMBER Clayface (2026) Release Date: September 11, 2026 Director: James Watkins Starring: Tom Rhys Harries , Naomi Ackie , Max Minghella After making an appearance in the animated Harley Quinn and Creature Commandos series, the iconic Batman villain Clayface returns to screens in his own live-action film. The film has been classified as a horror-thriller tragedy by producers Matt Reeves and Lynn Harris . While plot and cast details have not been revealed yet, it will be directed by James Watkins, whose experience in dark thrillers like Eden Lake and Speak No Evil (2024) should serve him well here. OCTOBER (Photo by Nickelodeon) The Legend of Aang: The Last Airbender (2026) Release Date: October 9, 2026 Director: Lauren Montgomery Starring: Eric Nam , Dave Bautista , Dante Basco The Avatar: The Last Airbender franchise welcomes its newest animated film with Toph, Sokka, Katara, and Zuko all bringing us back to the world fans love so much. Marvel’s Dave Bautista joins Eric Name, who takes on the role of the adult Aang as the Avatar: The Last Airbender universe expands. The love for the franchise has not diminished over the almost 20 years that it has be

Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 8 Upcoming Shows That Will Become Your Next Sci - Fi Addiction in 2026
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: Neuromancer isn't the only exciting sci - fi series set to premiere in 2026 . Joining it on next year's docket are completely original shows from popular creators, spinoffs to franchises long thought dead, and intriguing expansions of universes just now reaching for the stars.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: 8 Upcoming Shows That Will Become Your Next Sci-Fi Addiction in 2026 Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie News Movie Features Movie Lists Movie Reviews TV Submenu TV News TV Features TV Lists TV Reviews Comics Submenu Comics News Comics Features Comics Lists Comics Previews Comics Reviews Anime Submenu Anime News Anime Features Anime Lists Games Submenu Game News Game Features Game Lists Game Guides Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Community Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards MCU, DCU & More Dragon Ball Lord of the Rings Procedurals & Dramas Westerns Zelda Close Neuromancer & 7 Other Shows That Will Become Your Next Sci-Fi Addiction in 2026 A sea devil stands at the ready in Doctor Who: The War Between the Land and the Sea Image via BBC By Jordan Iacobucci Published 2 days ago Jordan Iacobucci has been an avid reader and movie fan since childhood. Jordan is known among his friends as the Marvel and Star Wars nerd, and even wrote a thirty-page college dissertation about Spider-Man! He has been a staff writer at both Screen Rant and CBR, where he enjoys sharing his love for pop culture with the world. Sign in to your CBR account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2026 may be one of the best years for new sci-fi series ever. Next year already has several promising new science fiction shows lined up for premieres, any one of which could become the world's new obsession. Included among these is Neuromancer , an adaptation of a novel once thought to be "unfilmable," but that is now finding new life on Apple TV+. Neuromancer isn't the only exciting sci-fi series set to premiere in 2026. Joining it on next year's docket are completely original shows from popular creators, spinoffs to franchises long thought dead, and intriguing expansions of universes just now reaching for the stars. There's plenty to love about next year's sci-fi offerings, and these shows top the list of new stories to look out for. Neuromancer Is the Riskiest Sci-Fi Series of the Decade Neuromancer book cover Image via Ace Books One of Apple TV+'s most exciting series of 2026 is Neuromancer , based on William Gibson's 1984 sci-fi novel of the same name. Neuromancer combines themes of dystopian literature, a sci-fi cyberpunk aesthetic, and a countercultural premise to create one distinctly unique story that has yet to be put to screen. The upcoming series features a phenomenal cast that includes Callum Turner, Mark Strong, Emma Laird, and Peter Sarsgaard. Neuromancer is an incredibly risky sci-fi series , with many studios having tried and failed to adapt the original novel to the big screen over the last several decades. Apple TV will be the first to successfully complete an adaptation, which will hopefully live up to fans' lofty expectations. If done right, Neuromancer could become the sci-fi event of the decade. Blade Runner 2099 Expands Ridley Scott's Underrated Sci-Fi World Humans hunt replicants in Blade Runner. Image via Warner Bros Blade Runner is finally coming back, nine years after the underrated Blade Runner 2049 flopped in theaters. This time, the cult classic franchise comes to the small screen in the form of Blade Runner 2099 , a miniseries set to premiere on Amazon Prime Video next year. Blade Runner 2099 will star Michelle Yeoh as the replicant Olwen, who contemplates mortality as her life seemingly approaches its bitter end. While Prime Video has revealed very little information about the upcoming spinoff, Blade Runner 2099 will borrow more from Ridley Scott's original Blade Runner than Denis Villeneuve's sequel. The series is the third and possibly final chance for Blade Runner to finally reach the wide audience it always needed to be a success. With an extended format and plenty of goodwill, Blade Runner 2099 could finally be the project that cracks the code for the franchise's success. Lanterns Expands James Gunn's DCU John Stewart and Hal Jordan walking down the street in civilian cothes from Lanterns-1 Image via DC Studios The next project on the docket for James Gunn's new DC Cinematic Universe (DCU) is Lanterns , an upcoming HBO Max series set to explore the inner workings of the Green Lantern Corps . The series, set to premiere sometime in 2026, will follow two Green Lanterns: Hal Jordan (Kyle Chandler), an older, more seasoned hero, and John Stewart (Aaron Pierre), who is just starting out as a member of the Corps. Together, they investigate a mysterious murder in a small town on Earth. Lanterns is especially exciting for comic book fans, who have waited decades for a proper live-action adaptation of the Green Lanterns from the DC universe. The series should also appeal to non-superhero fans, as it promises to explore fun science fiction themes and carve out a distinct corner for itself in the DCU. Shows like Lanterns always push the boundary on what television sci-fi can be, making this a can't-miss sci-fi event next year. Star Trek: Starfleet Academy Does Something New With the Classic Franchise The cadets at Starfleet Academy stand at attention Image via Paramount The universe of Star Trek is always expanding with new series that explore new corners of the final frontier. Now, Star Trek: Starfleet Academy takes the time to flesh out the very institution that created every hero the franchise has ever known. The upcoming spinoff takes place at the titular Starfleet Academy, where cadets train to become officers for the next generation of explorers. The new Star Trek series will premiere on January 15, 2026. With a promising cast that includes Holly Hunter, Tig Notaro, and Robert Picardo (returning as a hologram of The Doctor from Voyager ), Starfleet Academy has the chance to be the next great entry in the long-running sci-fi franchise. It focuses on an element of Star Trek lore that has yet to be fully fleshed out, giving fans something to look forward to as the mythos of their favorite fictional universe continues to expand. Doctor Who: The War Between the Land and the Sea Promises Big Things for Sci-Fi Fans Three sea devils stand at attention in Doctor Who: The War Between the Land and the Sea Image via BBC Although the future of Doctor Who itself remains in question following the show's recent separation from Disney+, at least one spinoff is still moving forward. The War Between the Land and the Sea is a long-gestating project from the mind of franchise superstar Russell T. Davies. The upcoming five-episode miniseries follows U.N.I.T. agents as they work to prevent a full-scale war from breaking out between humanity and the waterbound "Sea Devils." As the first Doctor Who spinoff in almost a decade, The War Between the Land and the Sea is an important moment in the franchise's history. When Doctor Who rebooted itself several years ago, it came with the promise that its universe would expand in multiple new spinoffs. The War Between the Land and the Sea is the first peek at what Russell T. Davies has in store for the Doctor Who franchise, but still works as a standalone story with an intriguing premise that sci-fi enthusiasts won't want to miss. Star Wars: Maul — Shadow Lord Follows The Clone Wars' Best Villain Darth Maul ignites his double-bladed lightsaber in Star Wars: The Clone Wars Image via Lucasfilm/Everett Collection The next Star Wars animation project is an exciting spinoff entitled Maul: Shadow Lord . The upcoming series is a direct follow-up to the perennial fan-favorite, Star Wars: The Clone Wars , following Darth Maul's journey after the fall of the Republic. The series will fill in the gaps of Darth Maul's Star Wars story , revealing how he ends up on Malachor during the events of Star Wars: Rebels . Darth Maul is consistently one of the most intriguing characters in the Star Wars canon, always stealing the show when he shows up in series like The Clone Wars and Rebels . Now, the franchise finally gets to focus exclusively on his character, making this one of Lucasfilm's most exciting upcoming projects. Fans of science fiction should also be excited, as Shadow Lord will also explore the vast Star Wars galaxy as it succumbs to the tyrannical rule of the Empire. The Boroughs Is a New Sci-Fi Show From the Duffer Brothers Netflix / Courtesy Everett Collection Netflix's worldwide phenomenon, Stranger Things , finally ends later this year, but its creators are already hard at work making their next television series. The Duffer Brothers' next project, The Boroughs, takes place in a seemingly normal retirement community, where a band of aging heroes must work together to foil an alien threat. Netflix has revealed very little about The Boroughs besides its premise and a release window of 2026. However, knowing the Duffer Brothers' terrific storytelling technique, it is bound to be yet another hit. With a stacked cast led by Bill Pullman, Geena Davis, Alfred Molina, Clarke Peters, Alfre Woodard, and more, The Boroughs may be Netflix's most exciting release next year. Vision Quest Follows Up on the MCU's Best Television Show Paul Bettany's White Vision looking at Wanda from Wandavision Disney+/Marvel Studios / Courtesy Everett Collection Vision Quest is a new upcoming series that takes place in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The series serves as a follow-up to WandaVision and Agatha All Along , two of the franchise's most highly rated Disney+ series ever. Vision Quest will follow Paul Bettany's synthezoid hero as he struggles to reclaim his memories and find meaning in life. While the MCU has been hit-or-miss with Disney+ series, Vision Quest has everything it needs to be one of the franchise's best shows yet. With a deep, psychological premise that feels fresh and new in the oversaturated superhero genre, the upcoming series could be one of the most deeply introspective entries in the entire MCU. Although there are still many mysteries surrounding Vision Quest and its place in the MCU , it could turn out to be a surprisingly terrific sci-fi series worth watching over and over again. Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: The limitless possibilities of sci-fi stories go some way to explain why the genre also tends to consistently be one of the most popular and sought after when it comes to theatrically released films. Indeed, based on 2026's sci-fi movie lineup, it seems the year is set to be rife with criticial and commercial hits within this realm.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie Features Movie News Movie Reviews Movie Lists Movie Trailers TV Submenu TV Features TV News TV Reviews Network TV TV Lists Reality TV Submenu Reality TV Features Reality TV News Reality TV Lists Gaming Submenu Game Features Game News Game Guides Game Reviews Game Lists Comics Submenu Comic Features Comic News Comic Reviews Comic Lists Anime Submenu Anime Features Anime News Anime Lists Music Submenu Music Features Music Lists Network TV Schedule Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Podcasts Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards Christmas Advent Calendar Exclusives Best on Streaming SR Database Network TV Schedule Close 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype Din Djarin and Grogu sitting in the cockpit of an N-1 Starfighter in The Mandalorian By Zoe Miskelly Published Dec 8, 2025 Zoë Miskelly is an editor for Screen Rant's Superheroes team, and has covered Marvel, DC, and other superhero franchises in comic, movie, and show form for 8 years. Zoë's love of superheroes and all things Marvel & DC started out in childhood, and has blossomed into a career getting to talk about some of the biggest and best movies and shows of all time, having previously focused on comics while working at WhatCulture. Sign in to your ScreenRant account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2026 is scheduled to have a considerable range of monumentally exciting sci-fi movies released within it - though some of these films have more hype built up for them than others for at least the time being. Historically, sci-fi is a genre that can be explored in an astronomical assortment of ways - from gritty and grueling dystopian tales, to remarkably light-hearted romps through futuristic lands and concepts. The limitless possibilities of sci-fi stories go some way to explain why the genre also tends to consistently be one of the most popular and sought after when it comes to theatrically released films. Indeed, based on 2026's sci-fi movie lineup, it seems the year is set to be rife with criticial and commercial hits within this realm. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die Sam Rockwell faces the camera in Good Luck Have Fun Don't Die While those lucky enough to attend the 2025 Fantastic Fest did garner an opportunity to watch a preview screening of sci-fi comedy Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die , the movie's full theatrical release is set to take place on February 13, 2026 , making it one of the first sci-fi films to release in the year. Based on Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die 's trailer - and strikingly solid 94% Rotten Tomatoes reviews from those who saw it early - it seems the film will be helping kick off the year in suitably stellar fashion. With a time travel premise that sees an unlucky inhabitant of a dystopian future journey back in time to try and save the world from its fate - recruiting a selection of seemingly random people from an LA diner in the hopes of creating a team that can protect humanity - it's clear Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die will be as entertaining as it is visually striking, making it an early must-watch for 2026. Flowervale Street Flowervale Street poster The mystery around Flowervale Street has worked in its favor in some ways when it comes to building hype around it from those who are aware of its existence. However, the relative lack of information we have about the movie does mean the main excitement around the film comes from the names that are currently attached to it, which include J.J. Abrams being one of the film's producers, and Anne Hathaway and Ewan McGregor being some of the main actors involved. Thus far, what's been teased for Flowervale Street seems to promise an exciting story, complete with at least one dinosaur and a street that's being affected by sci-fi phenomena, altering the lives of lead characters the Platt family forever - though more specifics about this installment will seemingly only become clearer closer to its scheduled August 14 release date . The Dog Stars The Dog Stars book cover Ridley Scott's history in the sci-fi genre is impossible to miss, with the likes of Alien , Blade Runner , and later The Martian cementing his reputation as someone who is able to give futuristic worlds and larger-than-life stories a grounded edge that makes them truly gripping throughout. As such, it's no surprise Scott's next sci-fi film, The Dog Stars , is one many are very excited to see release on March 27 . This is doubly true given the movie is adapting a book of the same name, which promises a suitably soulful and dramatic story of a man, his dog, and the gunman they befriended existing in a post-apocalyptic world, before one radio transmission sends the protagonists on an unexpected mission. Steven Spielberg's 2026 Movie Steven Spielberg at the London Premiere of The Thursday Murder Club John Rainford/Cover Images With Steven Spielberg being one of the biggest names in the directing sphere still decades into his career, his impending 2026 sci-fi release is naturally one that has a lot of intrigue and excitement around it - particularly since it appears details about the film may be being kept secret for as long as possible, given the name of the movie still isn't known, though its release is schedule for only months away on June 12, 2026 . Set to feature a range of talented actors - including Colman Domingo, Wyatt Russell, Emily Blunt and Colin Firth - Steven Spielberg's movie is reportedly based on an original idea from the director, and will be the first movie he's directed to hit cinemas since 2022's The Fabelmans . As such, there seems to be plenty of reasons to be excited about the film, even if we know little other than the fact it doesn't seem Steven Spielberg's sci-fi film is set to play in IMAX in 2026. Project Hail Mary Ryan Gosling in Project Hail Mary Combining a sci-fi story that is in many ways inherently suited to a big-screen adaptation - as is the case for Andy Weir's 2021 book Project Hail Mary - and some talented actors and directors seems a recipe built for success. As such, it's worth noting that Project Hail Mary is directed by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller - who may be most recognizable as the directors of the Spider-Verse films - and has Ryan Gosling play the movie's lead character, which all seems to suggest the film could well become one of the bigger movies of 2026 when it releases on March 20 . Project Hail Mary centers around Ryland Grace, a scientist whose primary challenge in the story comes when he finds himself on a space mission with no memory of who he is or what he was striving to do. Grace soon encounters an alien lifeform who becomes his main companion in this complex set of circumstances, with their dynamic unfolding into a truly emotional story about two very different worlds. Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping The Hunger Games has seen a resurgence in popularity thanks to 2023's The Hunger Games: A Ballad Of Songbirds And Snakes , which itself built hype for fellow Hunger Games prequel Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping - a film that is set to release on November 20, 2026 . Sunrise On The Reaping covers the story of Katniss' mentor, Haymitch Abernathy, and what his first Hunger Games was like - with the original books and movies providing some details regarding this matter, but leaving much of the 50th annual Hunger Games otherwise a mystery. Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping 's trailer has already demonstrated how the film will balance the action and tragedies that make the series so gripping, while also delving further into the history of both Haymitch himself, and the world of Panem, shedding more light on the events of the main timeline. Supergirl Milly Alcock as Supergirl in the Superman movie While there have been a fair number of live-action DC movies over the years, the films often veer away from showing the further reaches of the comic universe, instead focusing more squarely on Earth and the events that take place on it. This makes it all the more exciting that Supergirl seems set to do just the opposite with its story, since it looks to adapt the comic run of Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow, which takes place almost entirely on a range of different alien planets that are much unlike our own in many ways. Not only does this ensure Supergirl gets a more directly sci-fi-esque story - unlike Kal-El's adventures in the DCU's first movie, Superman - it also means the DC Universe's further corners can be fleshed out as early as its second film thanks to Supergirl 's June 26, 2026 release date , which has major implications for the wider franchise, too. Dune 3 Timothée Chalamet as Paul Atreides in Dune 2 looking off-screen Sci-fi's favorite alien worm series is set to return once more with the movie reboot's third installment, which is scheduled to debut on December 18, 2026 , and take viewers back to the world of Arrakis as Paul Atreides tries to unite its people to fight against the threat of House Harkonnen, who seek to take over the planet and its valuable resources. Now the first two installments of this series have built up a solid audience for the films and their epic story of how the cosmos are changed by the family of House Atreides forever, it seems the third film has a prime opportunity to delve into some of the biggest events in the book series - and introduce some of the bigger moral questions and plot twists that the story has to offer. Thus far, the 2020s Dune series has done a striking job of translating the sprawling sci-fi worlds of the books to life - both in its visuals and in the acting of its cast of characters - and it seems things are likely to only continue to amp up in this vital chapter of the story in every regard, painting a decidedly thrilling picture of what's to come for the franchise. The Mandalorian And Grogu Grogu eating cookies in The Mandalorian Mentioning there's hype for an upcoming Star Wars movie is perhaps as obvious as saying water is wet, even though the decades-old sci-fi world has seen some more divided reception in the past few years - which naturally bodes well for The Mandalorian and Grogu when it releases on May 22, 2026 . The Mandalorian and Grogu focusing on two of the most beloved new characters from the franchise's recent years should go some way to convince even those who have not been as keen on Star Wars' newer directions to give the film a chance, which suggests the already staggering brand appeal at play here can be capitalized on even further. With the opportunity to be a space-faring action-packed adventure, a follow-up on the aftermath of some of the biggest events in Star Wars' timeline, and a tale of an unusual found family finding their place in the galaxy, Din Djarin and Grogu's film story should theoretically have a little of something for every kind of Star Wars fan, and then some. Avengers: Doomsday Fantastic Four First Steps Post-Credits scene of Franklin Richards and Doctor Doom The sheer scope and scale teased for Avengers: Doomsday means it's inherently the biggest sci-fi movie of 2026 in terms of hype, even though the MCU has, much like Star Wars, had some more divided reception in recent months and years. The MCU has grown bigger and bigger over the course of its almost two-decade-long run, both in terms of the size of its world and stories, and in terms of its reputation. Doomsday will be the first Avengers movie since the genre-defining success of Avengers: Endgame - which sets a high bar for film in terms of what is possible for it when it releases on December 18, 2026 , but also ensures that a monumental amount of people are eagerly awaiting what this next chapter of the Avengers series holds, even if some may have their doubts about what might come next. With this next part of the MCU bringing back several major figures for the franchise - including many big Fox X-Men actors, and of course the return of Robert Downey Jr, this time playing Doctor Doom - the stage is set for a truly colossal story that pays tribute to not just every part of the MCU that came before it, but also to the wider Marvel movie world, thanks to the franchise's recent sci-fi forays into the concept of the multiverse. Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 - WhatCulture
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: A rundown of the biggest and most hotly anticipated sci-fi features coming next year.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content:
20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 WhatCulture About Team Advertise Contact Videos Quizzes Youtube Facebook Twitter Videos Search Film Home WWE TV Gaming Comics Music Offbeat Quizzes Comps Sport UFC Sign In Youtube Facebook Twitter Film WWE TV Gaming Comics Music Offbeat Quizzes More Search User menu 20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 A rundown of the biggest and most hotly anticipated sci-fi features coming next year. by Alisdair Hodgson Dec 8, 2025 December 8th, 2025 Disney 2025 has dished up a plethora of intriguing and excellent science
fiction films, from Denis Villeneuve's blockbuster epic Dune: Part Two, to
Yorgos Lanthimos' hillbilly conspiracy thriller Bugonia. And all this sets our
sights high for the coming year. Lucky, then, the studios and directors we
have given our time and money to will be delivering exactly what we want. Steven Spielberg returns to the broader genre for the first time
since 2018’s Ready Player One, and to alien films specifically since 2008’s
Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull. Ridley Scott is also
dusting off his lenses for an adaptation of Peter Heller’s The Dog Stars. Marvel fans who have felt let down by the middling films the
superhero giant has put out this decade have a new Spider-Man and Avengers
to look forward to, and DC die-hards get to see Supergirl finally take the
limelight on screen again after decades spent MIA. Other big franchises getting another chance to shine include
The Hunger Games, Mortal Kombat, and The Mandalorian (in its silver screen
debut), but there is also plenty for the indie crowd, with Maggie Gyllenhaal’s gangster
monster movie The Bride!, and Na Hong-jin’s alien thriller Hope - his first multinational
feature. It’s a full roster, and suffice to say, the following 20 movies are certain to become your most anticipated sci-fi films of 2026, if they’re not
already. 20. The Dresden Sun VMI Worldwide UK release date: February (day TBC) Science fiction fans who are hoping The Dresden Sun might be
an adaptation of Kurt Vonnegut’s Slaughterhouse 5 will be sorely disappointed
(our day will come!), but for everyone else, Michael Ryan’s upcoming picture
promises an exciting new entry in a rather niche genre: the sci-fi heist
movie. The film features converging narratives which see an expert mercenary
work an inside job to steal a big corporation’s most valued asset, while an
insurance analyst is caught in a web of corporate rivals and fraud, ending up
on the run from a military contractor. The first look trailer and those few
images available of The Dresden Sun so far suggest a high-tech, neon, Blade Runner
aesthetic paired with a modern corporate espionage crime thriller’s steely
edge. It definitely doesn’t have anything like the budget of many
of the other sci-fi flicks heading our way next year, but it’s got an
intriguing cast in Christina Ricci, Steven Ogg (Trevor from GTA V), and Mena
Suvari, and looks like it’s going to be a solid streaming watch. Next In this post: Sci-Fi films Science Fiction Movies Avengers: Doomsday 21st Century Sci-fi 2026 Movies The Mandalorian & Grogu Dune Part Three The Dresden Sun Posted On: 8th Dec 2025 Contributor Alisdair Hodgson Writer, editor, trend-setter. Slayer of gnomes and trolls.

Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 | Film Stories
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed with genre films from some of the world's most respected filmmakers: the last time we had Steven Spielberg and Ridley Scott release a sci-fi ...
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 | Film Stories Skip to the content Search Menu Search for: Submit News Features Reviews TV Gaming Podcasts All Episodes Store Live Events Subscriptions Magazines Digital Buy Digital Articles Login Magazine Film Stories Junior Subscription Deals Contact Us Feature News 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 by Ryan Lambie | December 15, 2025 2026 sci-fi Share this Article: Killer robots, brain-controlling diseases, UFOs and more: here’s our pick of 15 sci-fi films coming up in 2026… The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed ... 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 Killer robots, brain-controlling diseases, UFOs and more: here’s our pick of 15 sci-fi films coming up in 2026… The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed with genre films from some of the world’s most respected filmmakers: the last time we had Steven Spielberg and Ridley Scott release a sci-fi movie in the same year was in 1982. With apologies to any superhero movies that might happen to contain sci-fi elements (no Supergirl or Avengers: Doomsday here), please enjoy this list of the most exciting genre films coming up next year. Big budgets, small budgets, comedy elements, splashes of horror – there really is something for just about everyone in the list below. Let’s begin, then, with a cautionary tale about indulging in carnal relations with a household appliance… Soulm8te – 9th January (or perhaps not…) A shot from M3GAN 2.0. No official imagery available for Soulm8te at the time of writing, readers. Credit: Universal The year gets off to a rather saucy start with this spin-off from Blumhouse’s killer robot thriller, M3GAN. Soulm8te is said to be taking the franchise into erotic territory, as a lonely widower buys a gynoid to keep him company – only for the wretched thing to start wreaking havoc. Directed by Kate Dolan and starring David Rysdahl and Lily Sullivan, it sounds like similar territory to Subservience , a 2024 thriller starring Megan Fox, and numerous other films where human-robot relations turn sour. Will it be a bigger hit than M3GAN 2.0 , which was an unexpected disappointment in 2025? Dunno m8. (Since this post was written, Universal has reportedly taken Soulm8te off its 2026 calendar, and is now shopping it to other distributors. We haven’t seen any official confirmation of this as yet, but we’ll update this list if we do.) Bulk – January and February Noah Taylor on restrained form in Bulk. Credit: Film Four. British director Ben Wheatley’s career has spanned indie drama and horror ( Down Terrace, Kill List ) and expensive thrillers ( Rebecca, Meg 2: The Trench ). Bulk sees the filmmaker explore mind-bending science fiction, albeit in a uniquely DIY fashion. Shot on a tiny budget on domestic cameras (iPhones, SVHS and the like), Bulk sees protagonist Corey Harlan (Sam Riley) head off into a bizarre, dimension-spanning odyssey that includes an enigmatic scientist (Alexandra Maria Lara) and a variety of eccentric characters played by Noah Taylor. That Harlan’s odyssey takes place almost entirely in a single nondescript house doesn’t make it any less epic. Touring UK cinemas large and small in early 2026 , Bulk is possibly the most mesmerising, unusual genre films you’ll see all year. You certainly won’t forget it in a hurry. 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple – 14th January Ralph Fiennes holds his temple in 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple. Credit: Sony. Director Nia DaCosta takes over from Danny Boyle for the next chapter in a planned 28 Years trilogy, and by all accounts, this one’s an absolute corker. Picking up the thread from 2025’s sequel, it’s another journey into a country riven by superstition, disease and territorialism. We do wonder where screenwriter Alex Garland gets his out-there ideas from. Mercy – 23rd January We’ll try to go into this one with an open mind. It’s the latest film from director Timur Bekmambetov, previously known for the flashy action thriller, Wanted , but more recently associated with a series of ‘screenlife’ thrillers. He was producer on War Of The Worlds – a version of HG Wells’ invasion text viewed entirely through a computer interface. Starring Ice Cube and a supporting cast of Amazon goods and services, it was one of the most bafflingly misguided films of 2025 . But anyway: Mercy . Starring Chris Pratt, it’s set in a Minority Report -esque future where the entire legal system has been handed over to AI. Chris Pratt plays a detective who’s accused of murdering his own wife, and has 90 minutes to convince an icy digital judge (Rebecca Ferguson) of his innocence – or face summary execution. The perplexing thing about Mercy isn’t so much the premise as the venue; Amazon MGM’s giving it a big cinema push, including a run on 3D IMAX screens. The trailer dresses the film up a bit, but it’s still mostly a single-location thriller with plot points unfolding on computer screens. We’re not sure it screams big-screen, bring-your-chums entertainment – but again, we’ll keep an open mind. Suggested product Nicolas Cage Appreciation Coasters Merch £12.99 Suggested product Film Stories "I Try Not To Do Snark..." Tee Merch £22.99 Cold Storage – 13th February 2026 The Last Of Us played for laughs? Quite possibly. A storage facility becomes overrun by a mind-controlling fungus in a sci-fi comedy written by David Koepp – adapted from his own novel – and directed by Jonny Campbell ( Alien Autopsy ). Georgina Campbell ( Barbarian ) and Joe Keery ( Stranger Things ) star, and there’s a role too for Liam Neeson, who’s made some, er, interesting career choices of late. That’s hardly the film’s fault, though. The trailer is filled with gore and sweary, gross-out humour, and it all looks tremendously entertaining. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die – 20th February Another sci-fi comedy, Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die marks the return of director Gore Verbinski ( Rango , the Pirates Of The Caribbean franchise). Sam Rockwell stars as a dishevelled, oddly-dressed man who stumbles into a diner one night insisting that he’s from the future – and that he needs the customers’ help to avert a future war against machines. The film made its debut at 2025’s Fantastic Fest, where it garnered almost universally positive reviews. The supporting cast includes Zazie Beetz, Michael Pena and Juno Temple. We can’t wait. In The Blink Of An Eye – 27th February We were a bit worried about this film for a while. Finished in March 2025 , In The Blink Of An Eye sat without a release date for several months, with rumours of reshoots doing the rounds. The sci-fi drama is now making its premiere at the Sundance Film Festival, meaning it’ll screen there between late January and the 1st February. From Wall-E and John Carter director Andrew Stanton, In The Blink Of An Eye is an epoch-spanning fable that takes us from humanity’s earliest days to a spacecraft 200 years in the future. The script, by Colby Day, was on the Black List of best unproduced screenplays in 2016, and it’s a terrific read : seamlessly eliding between eras and characters at various points in history, all building to a truly emotional climax. Day also wrote Spaceman, an Adam Sandler sci-fi you can find on Netflix; In The Blink Of An Eye promises to be another terrific genre piece. (Unfortunately, In The Blink Of An Eye doesn’t appear to be getting a cinema release after its festival debut; instead, Disney has opted to send it directly to its Hulu screening service on the 27th February.) The Bride! – 26th March Not connected to Guillermo del Toro’s baroque take on Frankenstein made for Netflix, The Bride is the latest film from actor turned director Maggie Gyllenhaal. It stars Jessie Buckley as a mortally injured woman revived by Anette Bening’s Dr Euphronius, while Christian Bale plays the monster and the Bride’s betrothed. Moving Mary Shelley’s Gothic novel into the roaring (19)20s, it looks like a sumptuous and beautifully-designed tragic romance. Project Hail Mary – 20th March Based on the novel by Andy Weir, Project Hail Mary sees Ryan Gosling’s unassuming science teacher blasted into space in a last-ditch effort to save humanity. The trailer gave away a bit more of the book’s events than we were expecting, so maybe avoid that if you want to go into the cinema completely cold. The adaptation’s by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, so expect plenty of humour and heart as well as Weir’s plausibly detailed science fiction. In a case of unfortunate cosmic timing, Project Hail Mary places it rather near another major sci-fi film from a director whose last big hit was also a Weir adaptation… The Dog Stars – 27th March There aren’t any images for The Dog Stars kicking around yet, so please accept this still from 1980s children’s TV show, Children Of The Dog Star. We used to quite like it. Some of Ridley Scott’s most beloved and influential movies are in the sci-fi genre – Alien, Blade Runner and The Martian (the Weir adaptation we were on about above) are all markedly different in tone, but all classics in their own way. We’re excited to see what Scott’s done with The Dog Stars, then: adapted from Peter Heller’s novel, it’s set in a future world ravaged by a pandemic. Holed up in an aircraft hangar, the two protagonists – Jacog Elordi’s pilot, Hig and Josh Brolin’s sniper, Bangley – are coaxed back into the open world by a mysterious signal. Margaret Qualley, Guy Pearce and Benedict Wong also star. Given Scott’s visual flair – even his uneven Alien prequels were often lovely to look at – this is arguably one of our most anticipated genre films of the year. The Mandalorian And Grogu – 22nd May Lucasfilm’s first Star Wars movie in seven years, The Mandalorian And Grogu takes the hit Disney+ series out for a big screen spin-off – making it the Holiday On The Buses of space fantasies. We don’t know much about the plot, and frankly, we don’t need to know: as long as director Jon Favreau delivers on the pace and spectacle, we should be in for a pulpy, entertaining evening at the pictures. Pedro Pascal, Grogu, Sigourney Weaver and Jeremy Allan White all star – the latter as the alarmingly buff son of the late Jabba. Disclosure Day – 12th June It’s an absurdly stuffed year for respected directors making genre films. And Disclosure Day could be the biggest of the lot: it’s the latest from Steven Spielberg, and a return to the UFO-based subject matter of Close Encounters Of The Third Kind. It’s written by David Koepp (see Cold Storage earlier), who previously worked with Spielberg on the adapted screenplay for Jurassic Park, and following the autobiographical drama of The Fabelmans , it’s a return to the summer blockbuster experience the filmmaker essentially invented. Emily Blunt, Josh O’Connor and Wyatt Russell star; it’s about an attempt to reveal the truth about alien intelligence to the world, and a shadowy attempt to stop it. We think. The trailer’s big on intrigue and low on plot specifics. It compels us, though. Flowervale Street – 10th August A generic picture of a dinosaur, courtesy of Public Domain Pictures. It Follows was one of the great horror movies of the 2010s, and here comes its director, David Robert Mitchell, with some sort of time-travelling IMAX thriller involving dinosaurs. Ewen McGregor and Anne Hathaway are the starriest names among the warm-blooded cast. At present, we don’t know a whole lot more about this one, either, but Mitchell is a hugely talented director of both comedy and suspense. His previous film, Under Silver Lake , was an unfairly overlooked commercial disappointment, but we thought it was an absolute keeper. As such, we’ve high hopes for Flowervale Street . Bring on the dinosaurs. The Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping – 20th November Quentin Tarantino’s favourite killer contest franchise is back with another prequel, this one joining things up to the 2011 film that started it all. Hence why Jennifer Lawrence and Josh Hutcherson are making a return as Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark. Expect more oppression, death and romance; Francis Lawrence has become a dab hand at making these. And as The Long Walk proved, he’s quite an underrated director, both technically and in the performances he gets from his actors. Dune: Part Three – 18th December An epic moment of epicness in Dune: Part Two. Credit: Warner Bros. The year ends with a pinch of spice courtesy of director Denis Villeneuve. Timothee Chalamet, Zendaya and the rest of the Dune crew are back for a third visit to Arrakis, and given that this chapter will sail beyond the confines of Frank Herbert’s original novel, which formed the basis for the first two movies, it’ll be fascinating to see where the Canadian filmmaker takes the saga next. Herbert’s own follow-up, Dune Messiah, had some truly wild ideas that might not translate too well onto a cinema screen, but Villeneuve’s previous adaptations were spectacularly done. Also coming up, with no release date attached: Ray Gunn, the animated sci-fi noir passion project from Brad Bird; Godzilla Minus Zero, the follow-up to instant kaiju klassic, Godzilla Minus One . Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: Dec 8, 2025 · The limitless possibilities of sci-fi stories go some way to explain why the genre also tends to consistently be one of the most popular and sought after when it comes to theatrically released films. Indeed, based on 2026 's sci-fi movie lineup, it seems the year is set to be rife with criticial and commercial hits within this realm.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content: 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie Features Movie News Movie Reviews Movie Lists Movie Trailers TV Submenu TV Features TV News TV Reviews Network TV TV Lists Reality TV Submenu Reality TV Features Reality TV News Reality TV Lists Gaming Submenu Game Features Game News Game Guides Game Reviews Game Lists Comics Submenu Comic Features Comic News Comic Reviews Comic Lists Anime Submenu Anime Features Anime News Anime Lists Music Submenu Music Features Music Lists Network TV Schedule Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Podcasts Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards Christmas Advent Calendar Exclusives Best on Streaming SR Database Network TV Schedule Close 10 Most Exciting Upcoming 2026 Sci-Fi Movies, Ranked By Hype Din Djarin and Grogu sitting in the cockpit of an N-1 Starfighter in The Mandalorian By Zoe Miskelly Published Dec 8, 2025 Zoë Miskelly is an editor for Screen Rant's Superheroes team, and has covered Marvel, DC, and other superhero franchises in comic, movie, and show form for 8 years. Zoë's love of superheroes and all things Marvel & DC started out in childhood, and has blossomed into a career getting to talk about some of the biggest and best movies and shows of all time, having previously focused on comics while working at WhatCulture. Sign in to your ScreenRant account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2026 is scheduled to have a considerable range of monumentally exciting sci-fi movies released within it - though some of these films have more hype built up for them than others for at least the time being. Historically, sci-fi is a genre that can be explored in an astronomical assortment of ways - from gritty and grueling dystopian tales, to remarkably light-hearted romps through futuristic lands and concepts. The limitless possibilities of sci-fi stories go some way to explain why the genre also tends to consistently be one of the most popular and sought after when it comes to theatrically released films. Indeed, based on 2026's sci-fi movie lineup, it seems the year is set to be rife with criticial and commercial hits within this realm. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die Sam Rockwell faces the camera in Good Luck Have Fun Don't Die While those lucky enough to attend the 2025 Fantastic Fest did garner an opportunity to watch a preview screening of sci-fi comedy Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die , the movie's full theatrical release is set to take place on February 13, 2026 , making it one of the first sci-fi films to release in the year. Based on Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die 's trailer - and strikingly solid 94% Rotten Tomatoes reviews from those who saw it early - it seems the film will be helping kick off the year in suitably stellar fashion. With a time travel premise that sees an unlucky inhabitant of a dystopian future journey back in time to try and save the world from its fate - recruiting a selection of seemingly random people from an LA diner in the hopes of creating a team that can protect humanity - it's clear Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die will be as entertaining as it is visually striking, making it an early must-watch for 2026. Flowervale Street Flowervale Street poster The mystery around Flowervale Street has worked in its favor in some ways when it comes to building hype around it from those who are aware of its existence. However, the relative lack of information we have about the movie does mean the main excitement around the film comes from the names that are currently attached to it, which include J.J. Abrams being one of the film's producers, and Anne Hathaway and Ewan McGregor being some of the main actors involved. Thus far, what's been teased for Flowervale Street seems to promise an exciting story, complete with at least one dinosaur and a street that's being affected by sci-fi phenomena, altering the lives of lead characters the Platt family forever - though more specifics about this installment will seemingly only become clearer closer to its scheduled August 14 release date . The Dog Stars The Dog Stars book cover Ridley Scott's history in the sci-fi genre is impossible to miss, with the likes of Alien , Blade Runner , and later The Martian cementing his reputation as someone who is able to give futuristic worlds and larger-than-life stories a grounded edge that makes them truly gripping throughout. As such, it's no surprise Scott's next sci-fi film, The Dog Stars , is one many are very excited to see release on March 27 . This is doubly true given the movie is adapting a book of the same name, which promises a suitably soulful and dramatic story of a man, his dog, and the gunman they befriended existing in a post-apocalyptic world, before one radio transmission sends the protagonists on an unexpected mission. Steven Spielberg's 2026 Movie Steven Spielberg at the London Premiere of The Thursday Murder Club John Rainford/Cover Images With Steven Spielberg being one of the biggest names in the directing sphere still decades into his career, his impending 2026 sci-fi release is naturally one that has a lot of intrigue and excitement around it - particularly since it appears details about the film may be being kept secret for as long as possible, given the name of the movie still isn't known, though its release is schedule for only months away on June 12, 2026 . Set to feature a range of talented actors - including Colman Domingo, Wyatt Russell, Emily Blunt and Colin Firth - Steven Spielberg's movie is reportedly based on an original idea from the director, and will be the first movie he's directed to hit cinemas since 2022's The Fabelmans . As such, there seems to be plenty of reasons to be excited about the film, even if we know little other than the fact it doesn't seem Steven Spielberg's sci-fi film is set to play in IMAX in 2026. Project Hail Mary Ryan Gosling in Project Hail Mary Combining a sci-fi story that is in many ways inherently suited to a big-screen adaptation - as is the case for Andy Weir's 2021 book Project Hail Mary - and some talented actors and directors seems a recipe built for success. As such, it's worth noting that Project Hail Mary is directed by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller - who may be most recognizable as the directors of the Spider-Verse films - and has Ryan Gosling play the movie's lead character, which all seems to suggest the film could well become one of the bigger movies of 2026 when it releases on March 20 . Project Hail Mary centers around Ryland Grace, a scientist whose primary challenge in the story comes when he finds himself on a space mission with no memory of who he is or what he was striving to do. Grace soon encounters an alien lifeform who becomes his main companion in this complex set of circumstances, with their dynamic unfolding into a truly emotional story about two very different worlds. Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping The Hunger Games has seen a resurgence in popularity thanks to 2023's The Hunger Games: A Ballad Of Songbirds And Snakes , which itself built hype for fellow Hunger Games prequel Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping - a film that is set to release on November 20, 2026 . Sunrise On The Reaping covers the story of Katniss' mentor, Haymitch Abernathy, and what his first Hunger Games was like - with the original books and movies providing some details regarding this matter, but leaving much of the 50th annual Hunger Games otherwise a mystery. Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping 's trailer has already demonstrated how the film will balance the action and tragedies that make the series so gripping, while also delving further into the history of both Haymitch himself, and the world of Panem, shedding more light on the events of the main timeline. Supergirl Milly Alcock as Supergirl in the Superman movie While there have been a fair number of live-action DC movies over the years, the films often veer away from showing the further reaches of the comic universe, instead focusing more squarely on Earth and the events that take place on it. This makes it all the more exciting that Supergirl seems set to do just the opposite with its story, since it looks to adapt the comic run of Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow, which takes place almost entirely on a range of different alien planets that are much unlike our own in many ways. Not only does this ensure Supergirl gets a more directly sci-fi-esque story - unlike Kal-El's adventures in the DCU's first movie, Superman - it also means the DC Universe's further corners can be fleshed out as early as its second film thanks to Supergirl 's June 26, 2026 release date , which has major implications for the wider franchise, too. Dune 3 Timothée Chalamet as Paul Atreides in Dune 2 looking off-screen Sci-fi's favorite alien worm series is set to return once more with the movie reboot's third installment, which is scheduled to debut on December 18, 2026 , and take viewers back to the world of Arrakis as Paul Atreides tries to unite its people to fight against the threat of House Harkonnen, who seek to take over the planet and its valuable resources. Now the first two installments of this series have built up a solid audience for the films and their epic story of how the cosmos are changed by the family of House Atreides forever, it seems the third film has a prime opportunity to delve into some of the biggest events in the book series - and introduce some of the bigger moral questions and plot twists that the story has to offer. Thus far, the 2020s Dune series has done a striking job of translating the sprawling sci-fi worlds of the books to life - both in its visuals and in the acting of its cast of characters - and it seems things are likely to only continue to amp up in this vital chapter of the story in every regard, painting a decidedly thrilling picture of what's to come for the franchise. The Mandalorian And Grogu Grogu eating cookies in The Mandalorian Mentioning there's hype for an upcoming Star Wars movie is perhaps as obvious as saying water is wet, even though the decades-old sci-fi world has seen some more divided reception in the past few years - which naturally bodes well for The Mandalorian and Grogu when it releases on May 22, 2026 . The Mandalorian and Grogu focusing on two of the most beloved new characters from the franchise's recent years should go some way to convince even those who have not been as keen on Star Wars' newer directions to give the film a chance, which suggests the already staggering brand appeal at play here can be capitalized on even further. With the opportunity to be a space-faring action-packed adventure, a follow-up on the aftermath of some of the biggest events in Star Wars' timeline, and a tale of an unusual found family finding their place in the galaxy, Din Djarin and Grogu's film story should theoretically have a little of something for every kind of Star Wars fan, and then some. Avengers: Doomsday Fantastic Four First Steps Post-Credits scene of Franklin Richards and Doctor Doom The sheer scope and scale teased for Avengers: Doomsday means it's inherently the biggest sci-fi movie of 2026 in terms of hype, even though the MCU has, much like Star Wars, had some more divided reception in recent months and years. The MCU has grown bigger and bigger over the course of its almost two-decade-long run, both in terms of the size of its world and stories, and in terms of its reputation. Doomsday will be the first Avengers movie since the genre-defining success of Avengers: Endgame - which sets a high bar for film in terms of what is possible for it when it releases on December 18, 2026 , but also ensures that a monumental amount of people are eagerly awaiting what this next chapter of the Avengers series holds, even if some may have their doubts about what might come next. With this next part of the MCU bringing back several major figures for the franchise - including many big Fox X-Men actors, and of course the return of Robert Downey Jr, this time playing Doctor Doom - the stage is set for a truly colossal story that pays tribute to not just every part of the MCU that came before it, but also to the wider Marvel movie world, thanks to the franchise's recent sci-fi forays into the concept of the multiverse. Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.title: 20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 - WhatCulture
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.snippet: Dec 8, 2025 · A rundown of the biggest and most hotly anticipated sci-fi features coming next year.
Most anticipated sci-fi movies releasing.content:
20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 WhatCulture About Team Advertise Contact Videos Quizzes Youtube Facebook Twitter Videos Search Film Home WWE TV Gaming Comics Music Offbeat Quizzes Comps Sport UFC Sign In Youtube Facebook Twitter Film WWE TV Gaming Comics Music Offbeat Quizzes More Search User menu 20 Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies Arriving In 2026 A rundown of the biggest and most hotly anticipated sci-fi features coming next year. by Alisdair Hodgson Dec 8, 2025 December 8th, 2025 Disney 2025 has dished up a plethora of intriguing and excellent science
fiction films, from Denis Villeneuve's blockbuster epic Dune: Part Two, to
Yorgos Lanthimos' hillbilly conspiracy thriller Bugonia. And all this sets our
sights high for the coming year. Lucky, then, the studios and directors we
have given our time and money to will be delivering exactly what we want. Steven Spielberg returns to the broader genre for the first time
since 2018’s Ready Player One, and to alien films specifically since 2008’s
Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull. Ridley Scott is also
dusting off his lenses for an adaptation of Peter Heller’s The Dog Stars. Marvel fans who have felt let down by the middling films the
superhero giant has put out this decade have a new Spider-Man and Avengers
to look forward to, and DC die-hards get to see Supergirl finally take the
limelight on screen again after decades spent MIA. Other big franchises getting another chance to shine include
The Hunger Games, Mortal Kombat, and The Mandalorian (in its silver screen
debut), but there is also plenty for the indie crowd, with Maggie Gyllenhaal’s gangster
monster movie The Bride!, and Na Hong-jin’s alien thriller Hope - his first multinational
feature. It’s a full roster, and suffice to say, the following 20 movies are certain to become your most anticipated sci-fi films of 2026, if they’re not
already. 20. The Dresden Sun VMI Worldwide UK release date: February (day TBC) Science fiction fans who are hoping The Dresden Sun might be
an adaptation of Kurt Vonnegut’s Slaughterhouse 5 will be sorely disappointed
(our day will come!), but for everyone else, Michael Ryan’s upcoming picture
promises an exciting new entry in a rather niche genre: the sci-fi heist
movie. The film features converging narratives which see an expert mercenary
work an inside job to steal a big corporation’s most valued asset, while an
insurance analyst is caught in a web of corporate rivals and fraud, ending up
on the run from a military contractor. The first look trailer and those few
images available of The Dresden Sun so far suggest a high-tech, neon, Blade Runner
aesthetic paired with a modern corporate espionage crime thriller’s steely
edge. It definitely doesn’t have anything like the budget of many
of the other sci-fi flicks heading our way next year, but it’s got an
intriguing cast in Christina Ricci, Steven Ogg (Trevor from GTA V), and Mena
Suvari, and looks like it’s going to be a solid streaming watch. Slayer of gnomes and trolls.
