**15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 | Film Stories** (source: https://filmstories.co.uk/features/15-sci-fi-films-to-look-forward-to-in-2026/)
Summary: 2 days ago · The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed with genre films from some of the world’s most respected filmmakers: the last time we had Steven Spielberg and Ridley Scott release a sci-fi ...
Full content: 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 | Film Stories Skip to the content Search Menu Search for: Submit News Features Reviews TV Gaming Podcasts All Episodes Store Live Events Subscriptions Magazines Digital Buy Digital Articles Login Magazine Film Stories Junior Subscription Deals Contact Us Feature News 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 by Ryan Lambie | December 15, 2025 2026 sci-fi Share this Article: Killer robots, brain-controlling diseases, UFOs and more: here’s our pick of 15 sci-fi films coming up in 2026… The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed ... 15 sci-fi films to look forward to in 2026 Killer robots, brain-controlling diseases, UFOs and more: here’s our pick of 15 sci-fi films coming up in 2026… The real world increasingly resembles a rubbish sci-fi thriller, so thank heavens that we can retreat to the safety of cinema and escapist stories about rampaging AI, over-powered corporations and totalitarian governments. And 2026 is positively stuffed with genre films from some of the world’s most respected filmmakers: the last time we had Steven Spielberg and Ridley Scott release a sci-fi movie in the same year was in 1982. With apologies to any superhero movies that might happen to contain sci-fi elements (no Supergirl or Avengers: Doomsday here), please enjoy this list of the most exciting genre films coming up next year. Big budgets, small budgets, comedy elements, splashes of horror – there really is something for just about everyone in the list below. Let’s begin, then, with a cautionary tale about indulging in carnal relations with a household appliance… Soulm8te – 9th January (or perhaps not…) A shot from M3GAN 2.0. No official imagery available for Soulm8te at the time of writing, readers. Credit: Universal The year gets off to a rather saucy start with this spin-off from Blumhouse’s killer robot thriller, M3GAN. Soulm8te is said to be taking the franchise into erotic territory, as a lonely widower buys a gynoid to keep him company – only for the wretched thing to start wreaking havoc. Directed by Kate Dolan and starring David Rysdahl and Lily Sullivan, it sounds like similar territory to Subservience , a 2024 thriller starring Megan Fox, and numerous other films where human-robot relations turn sour. Will it be a bigger hit than M3GAN 2.0 , which was an unexpected disappointment in 2025? Dunno m8. (Since this post was written, Universal has reportedly taken Soulm8te off its 2026 calendar, and is now shopping it to other distributors. We haven’t seen any official confirmation of this as yet, but we’ll update this list if we do.) Bulk – January and February Noah Taylor on restrained form in Bulk. Credit: Film Four. British director Ben Wheatley’s career has spanned indie drama and horror ( Down Terrace, Kill List ) and expensive thrillers ( Rebecca, Meg 2: The Trench ). Bulk sees the filmmaker explore mind-bending science fiction, albeit in a uniquely DIY fashion. Shot on a tiny budget on domestic cameras (iPhones, SVHS and the like), Bulk sees protagonist Corey Harlan (Sam Riley) head off into a bizarre, dimension-spanning odyssey that includes an enigmatic scientist (Alexandra Maria Lara) and a variety of eccentric characters played by Noah Taylor. That Harlan’s odyssey takes place almost entirely in a single nondescript house doesn’t make it any less epic. Touring UK cinemas large and small in early 2026 , Bulk is possibly the most mesmerising, unusual genre films you’ll see all year. You certainly won’t forget it in a hurry. 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple – 14th January Ralph Fiennes holds his temple in 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple. Credit: Sony. Director Nia DaCosta takes over from Danny Boyle for the next chapter in a planned 28 Years trilogy, and by all accounts, this one’s an absolute corker. Picking up the thread from 2025’s sequel, it’s another journey into a country riven by superstition, disease and territorialism. We do wonder where screenwriter Alex Garland gets his out-there ideas from. Mercy – 23rd January We’ll try to go into this one with an open mind. It’s the latest film from director Timur Bekmambetov, previously known for the flashy action thriller, Wanted , but more recently associated with a series of ‘screenlife’ thrillers. He was producer on War Of The Worlds – a version of HG Wells’ invasion text viewed entirely through a computer interface. Starring Ice Cube and a supporting cast of Amazon goods and services, it was one of the most bafflingly misguided films of 2025 . But anyway: Mercy . Starring Chris Pratt, it’s set in a Minority Report -esque future where the entire legal system has been handed over to AI. Chris Pratt plays a detective who’s accused of murdering his own wife, and has 90 minutes to convince an icy digital judge (Rebecca Ferguson) of his innocence – or face summary execution. The perplexing thing about Mercy isn’t so much the premise as the venue; Amazon MGM’s giving it a big cinema push, including a run on 3D IMAX screens. The trailer dresses the film up a bit, but it’s still mostly a single-location thriller with plot points unfolding on computer screens. We’re not sure it screams big-screen, bring-your-chums entertainment – but again, we’ll keep an open mind. Suggested product 'Worst Timeline' Mug Merch £10.99 Suggested product Issue #55 (Deep Cover): Print Magazine Magazine £6.99 Cold Storage – 13th February 2026 The Last Of Us played for laughs? Quite possibly. A storage facility becomes overrun by a mind-controlling fungus in a sci-fi comedy written by David Koepp – adapted from his own novel – and directed by Jonny Campbell ( Alien Autopsy ). Georgina Campbell ( Barbarian ) and Joe Keery ( Stranger Things ) star, and there’s a role too for Liam Neeson, who’s made some, er, interesting career choices of late. That’s hardly the film’s fault, though. The trailer is filled with gore and sweary, gross-out humour, and it all looks tremendously entertaining. Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die – 20th February Another sci-fi comedy, Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die marks the return of director Gore Verbinski ( Rango , the Pirates Of The Caribbean franchise). Sam Rockwell stars as a dishevelled, oddly-dressed man who stumbles into a diner one night insisting that he’s from the future – and that he needs the customers’ help to avert a future war against machines. The film made its debut at 2025’s Fantastic Fest, where it garnered almost universally positive reviews. The supporting cast includes Zazie Beetz, Michael Pena and Juno Temple. We can’t wait. In The Blink Of An Eye – 27th February We were a bit worried about this film for a while. Finished in March 2025 , In The Blink Of An Eye sat without a release date for several months, with rumours of reshoots doing the rounds. The sci-fi drama is now making its premiere at the Sundance Film Festival, meaning it’ll screen there between late January and the 1st February. From Wall-E and John Carter director Andrew Stanton, In The Blink Of An Eye is an epoch-spanning fable that takes us from humanity’s earliest days to a spacecraft 200 years in the future. The script, by Colby Day, was on the Black List of best unproduced screenplays in 2016, and it’s a terrific read : seamlessly eliding between eras and characters at various points in history, all building to a truly emotional climax. Day also wrote Spaceman, an Adam Sandler sci-fi you can find on Netflix; In The Blink Of An Eye promises to be another terrific genre piece. (Unfortunately, In The Blink Of An Eye doesn’t appear to be getting a cinema release after its festival debut; instead, Disney has opted to send it directly to its Hulu screening service on the 27th February.) The Bride! – 26th March Not connected to Guillermo del Toro’s baroque take on Frankenstein made for Netflix, The Bride is the latest film from actor turned director Maggie Gyllenhaal. It stars Jessie Buckley as a mortally injured woman revived by Anette Bening’s Dr Euphronius, while Christian Bale plays the monster and the Bride’s betrothed. Moving Mary Shelley’s Gothic novel into the roaring (19)20s, it looks like a sumptuous and beautifully-designed tragic romance. Project Hail Mary – 20th March Based on the novel by Andy Weir, Project Hail Mary sees Ryan Gosling’s unassuming science teacher blasted into space in a last-ditch effort to save humanity. The trailer gave away a bit more of the book’s events than we were expecting, so maybe avoid that if you want to go into the cinema completely cold. The adaptation’s by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, so expect plenty of humour and heart as well as Weir’s plausibly detailed science fiction. In a case of unfortunate cosmic timing, Project Hail Mary places it rather near another major sci-fi film from a director whose last big hit was also a Weir adaptation… The Dog Stars – 27th March There aren’t any images for The Dog Stars kicking around yet, so please accept this still from 1980s children’s TV show, Children Of The Dog Star. We used to quite like it. Some of Ridley Scott’s most beloved and influential movies are in the sci-fi genre – Alien, Blade Runner and The Martian (the Weir adaptation we were on about above) are all markedly different in tone, but all classics in their own way. We’re excited to see what Scott’s done with The Dog Stars, then: adapted from Peter Heller’s novel, it’s set in a future world ravaged by a pandemic. Holed up in an aircraft hangar, the two protagonists – Jacog Elordi’s pilot, Hig and Josh Brolin’s sniper, Bangley – are coaxed back into the open world by a mysterious signal. Margaret Qualley, Guy Pearce and Benedict Wong also star. Given Scott’s visual flair – even his uneven Alien prequels were often lovely to look at – this is arguably one of our most anticipated genre films of the year. The Mandalorian And Grogu – 22nd May Lucasfilm’s first Star Wars movie in seven years, The Mandalorian And Grogu takes the hit Disney+ series out for a big screen spin-off – making it the Holiday On The Buses of space fantasies. We don’t know much about the plot, and frankly, we don’t need to know: as long as director Jon Favreau delivers on the pace and spectacle, we should be in for a pulpy, entertaining evening at the pictures. Pedro Pascal, Grogu, Sigourney Weaver and Jeremy Allan White all star – the latter as the alarmingly buff son of the late Jabba. Disclosure Day – 12th June It’s an absurdly stuffed year for respected directors making genre films. And Disclosure Day could be the biggest of the lot: it’s the latest from Steven Spielberg, and a return to the UFO-based subject matter of Close Encounters Of The Third Kind. It’s written by David Koepp (see Cold Storage earlier), who previously worked with Spielberg on the adapted screenplay for Jurassic Park, and following the autobiographical drama of The Fabelmans , it’s a return to the summer blockbuster experience the filmmaker essentially invented. Emily Blunt, Josh O’Connor and Wyatt Russell star; it’s about an attempt to reveal the truth about alien intelligence to the world, and a shadowy attempt to stop it. We think. The trailer’s big on intrigue and low on plot specifics. It compels us, though. Flowervale Street – 10th August A generic picture of a dinosaur, courtesy of Public Domain Pictures. It Follows was one of the great horror movies of the 2010s, and here comes its director, David Robert Mitchell, with some sort of time-travelling IMAX thriller involving dinosaurs. Ewen McGregor and Anne Hathaway are the starriest names among the warm-blooded cast. At present, we don’t know a whole lot more about this one, either, but Mitchell is a hugely talented director of both comedy and suspense. His previous film, Under Silver Lake , was an unfairly overlooked commercial disappointment, but we thought it was an absolute keeper. As such, we’ve high hopes for Flowervale Street . Bring on the dinosaurs. The Hunger Games: Sunrise On The Reaping – 20th November Quentin Tarantino’s favourite killer contest franchise is back with another prequel, this one joining things up to the 2011 film that started it all. Hence why Jennifer Lawrence and Josh Hutcherson are making a return as Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark. Expect more oppression, death and romance; Francis Lawrence has become a dab hand at making these. And as The Long Walk proved, he’s quite an underrated director, both technically and in the performances he gets from his actors. Dune: Part Three – 18th December An epic moment of epicness in Dune: Part Two. Credit: Warner Bros. The year ends with a pinch of spice courtesy of director Denis Villeneuve. Timothee Chalamet, Zendaya and the rest of the Dune crew are back for a third visit to Arrakis, and given that this chapter will sail beyond the confines of Frank Herbert’s original novel, which formed the basis for the first two movies, it’ll be fascinating to see where the Canadian filmmaker takes the saga next. Herbert’s own follow-up, Dune Messiah, had some truly wild ideas that might not translate too well onto a cinema screen, but Villeneuve’s previous adaptations were spectacularly done. Also coming up, with no release date attached: Ray Gunn, the animated sci-fi noir passion project from Brad Bird; Godzilla Minus Zero, the follow-up to instant kaiju klassic, Godzilla Minus One . **I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026** (source: https://www.cbr.com/most-anticipated-2026-animated-movies/)
Summary: Animated releases in 2026 , including Minions 3 and Shrek 5, are expected to be some of the most exciting movies of the year.
Full content: I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie News Movie Features Movie Lists Movie Reviews TV Submenu TV News TV Features TV Lists TV Reviews Comics Submenu Comics News Comics Features Comics Lists Comics Previews Comics Reviews Anime Submenu Anime News Anime Features Anime Lists Games Submenu Game News Game Features Game Lists Game Guides Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Community Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads 2 More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards MCU, DCU & More Dragon Ball Lord of the Rings Procedurals & Dramas Westerns Zelda Close I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 Image by Morena Perez Vitale By Emme Oliver Published Aug 6, 2025 Emme Oliver is a writer and filmmaker from Bucks County, Pennsylvania. She obtained a Bachelor's of Arts in Screen Studies from The New School in 2024 and has written for popculturepress.org and switchbitchnoise.com. Her creative fiction has been published in numerous online magazines including Anti-Heroin Chic, The Scarlet Leaf Review, and Academy of the Heart and Mind. Her short film "Regression" was featured in the 2024 edition of The New Screen Fest Film Festival. Sign in to your CBR account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread 2 Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2025 has already seen some amazing movie releases, with Sinners dominating at the box office, ranking at number 11 on the list of the highest-grossing films of the year, according to Box Office Mojo . Superman and the live-action Lilo & Stitch remake have also done exceptionally well, bringing beloved characters back to the big screen. The end of the year is set to finish strong with Wicked: For Good , Avatar: Fire and Ash , and Five Nights at Freddy 's 2 set to release in November and December. Many animated films have fallen short, but the Chinese fantasy film N e Zha II is the highest-grossing film of 2025 thus far, and Disney is set to release the anticipated Zootopia 2 around Thanksgiving. 2026 is seeing the release of a variety of exciting animated films , including many sequels that are already inspiring hype in audiences who can't wait to see their favorite characters and new stories come to theaters. 10 Minions 3 Is Bound to Be Another Wacky Adventure Releasing July 1, 2026 Child Gru is intimidating one of the Minions in Minions: The Rise of Gru. Image via Illumination Minions: The Rise of Gru in 2022 made headlines not necessarily for critical reasons, but for its box office performance and an odd trend that may have been linked to its financial success. The "gentleminions" trend on TikTok saw several large groups of young men attending the film in suits, which seemed like a fun stunt until there were complaints about these viewers being particularly disruptive during screenings. Parents complained about not being able to enjoy the film with their kids because of littering, talking and other disturbances, which would appear again this year during A Minecraft Movie during the infamous "chicken jockey" scene . Minions 3 is likely not going to garner the same attention in meme culture as the trend died down once some theaters resorted to banning viewers in formal attire, but that won't stop families from attending to see the rambunctious yellow creatures get up to more mischief. Not many plot details about the film have been revealed, but Steve Carell is returning to voice Gru , and there are rumors that Alan Arkin will return as Wild Knuckles, who was prominently featured in the last film. 9 Ice Age 6 Will Hopefully Reinvigorate the Franchise Releasing December 18, 2026 Image Via 20th Century Animation With the critical bomb that was The Ice Age Adventures of Buck Wild , the last Ice Age film , things aren't looking so good for the franchise. With the first film being over two decades old, it may seem like audiences are tired of this franchise. However, the films have an exceptional voice cast with Ray Romano as Manny, Queen Latifah as Ellie, John Leguizamo as Sid and Simon Pegg as Buck. These are characters that audiences have grown up with and seen through catastrophic adventures. A story for the film hasn't been revealed yet , but an official poster for the film features familiar characters, including Brooke, voiced by Jessie J, and Shira, voiced by Jennifer Lopez, who are Sid and Diego's respective love interests. The poster sees Manny with his signature bulging eyes and worried expression while holding a spear, which could indicate another dangerous conflict for the found family of animals. 8 Goat is a Clever Play on Words For an Upcoming Sports Film Releasing February 13, 2026 Image Via Sony Pictures Animation Aside from a fun title and its appeal to basketball fans, Goat has an excellent creative team behind it. The film is directed by Tyree Dillihay, who is a director for the hit animated series Bob's Burgers , and Adam Rosette, who is a co-director at Sony Pictures Animation, known for his work on Orion and the Dark and The Wild Robot . Goat takes place in a world of anthropomorphic animals where a young goat named Will Harris dreams of becoming a professional basketball player despite his smaller stature. In addition to a great behind-the-scenes team, the cast is stacked with Stranger Things 's Caleb McLaughlin playing Will. His co-star, David Harbour, is also in the cast along with Nicola Coughlan, Nick Kroll, Gabrielle Union, Jenifer Lewis, Patton Oswalt and renowned basketball player Stephen Curry, who is also a producer for the film. The animation and designs for the animals are stunning, but it's to be expected from Sony Pictures Animation , whose inventive style has been impressing audiences since 2018 with Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse . 7 The Cat in the Hat Looks Like Another Inventive Dr. Seuss Story Brought to Life Releasing February 27, 2026 The Cat in the Hat poses in a car in the new movie. Image via Warner Bros. Many Dr. Seuss stories have made their way to the modern big screen in animated form, starting with Horton Hears a Who! in 2008 . Since then, Illumination has taken on the mantle, releasing The Lorax in 2012 and The Grinch in 2018. The Cat and the Hat is produced by Warner Bros. in the creative and popular 2.5D animation style, which melds hand-drawn animation with computer-generated animation. Comedian Bill Hader plays the chaotic Cat with Xochitl Gomez, Quinta Brunson, Matt Berry and Giancarlo Esposito also appearing in the cast. The film sees the Cat in the Hat , who has gained a reputation from the I.I.I.I. (Institute for the Institution of Imagination and Inspiration, LLC) for being irresponsible on his missions, facing his toughest task yet. He's tasked with cheering up two siblings who are struggling with their move to a new town. The film will bring some much-needed joy and laughter to audiences in addition to introducing Dr. Seuss's magical stories to new generations. 6 Shrek 5 Sees a New Chapter For the Ogre Family Releasing December 23, 2026 Shrek and Donkey scream in terror in Shrek 5 teaser Image via DreamWorks Animation Shrek 5 gained a massive amount of attention upon the release of its teaser earlier this year, with some Shrek fans complaining about the updated look of the characters and the changes that have been made to their design. Other fans expressed excitement over the original cast returning as well as the inclusion of Zendaya as Felicia, Shrek and Fiona's teenage daughter. The teaser is short, but it contains the same zippy and somewhat raunchy humor the series is known for , which is enough to have fans ready to be seated in theaters. As mentioned, Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy and Cameron Diaz are returning as Shrek, Donkey and Fiona. Other characters like Pinocchio and the Magic Mirror make an appearance, with the Magic Mirror acting almost like a phone screen showing different edits and memes of Shrek to the horror, surprise, and excitement of the family. Major story details aren't out in the open yet, but many are theorizing that it will center around the relationship between Shrek and Felicia and her potential rebellious streak. 5 Toy Story 5 Brings the Toys Back Once Again Releasing June 19, 2026 Woody looks at Bo in Toy Story 4 Image via Pixar Since Toy Story was released in 1995, Woody, Buzz, Mr. Potato Head, Rex and the whole gang have been warming the hearts of families. Though Pixar's eclectic catalog is full of classics, there aren't any films quite like the Toy Story franchise . Woody separating from the rest of his family to be a lost toy with Bo Peep didn't sit well with all audiences at the divisive ending of Toy Story 4 , and many are wondering what the fifth film will entail. The plot will revolve around a very pertinent premise, with the toys having to compete with electronics, which have captured the attention of kids. Woody is featured in the concept art on the official Pixar website, and Tom Hanks is listed in the cast, so Woody is bound to make an appearance. Jessie, Bullseye, Hamm, Slinky and Forky, who was introduced in the last film, are also in the released pictures, so it seems like everyone's favorite characters are returning for the next installment . 4 The Legendaries Looks Like an Epic Fantasy Film Releasing January 28, 2026 Image via Pan Cinema Based on the comic book series of the same name by Patrick Sobral, The Legendaries follows a group of heroes who protect the fantastical world of Alysia. While fighting a formidable sorcerer named Darkhell, they end up breaking a magical stone that turns the powerful warriors into young children. All of humanity is cursed, and the once-revered heroes are forced into hiding as they're blamed for the unfortunate circumstances. The film sees the young heroes reunite and restore their friendship, on a quest to become the warriors they once were. The film is being directed by Guillaume Ivernel, who is known for Dragon Hunters , Spycies , and Leap! . Though The Legendaries is being produced in and being released first in France, fantasy fans worldwide can look forward to this film, as well as fans of the original series . 3 The Super Mario Bros. Movie Sequel Is Expected to Be an Amazing Follow-Up Releasing May 14, 2026 Mario and Luigi celebrating a job well done in The Super Mario Bros. Movie Image via Universal Pictures The Super Mario Bros. Movie was a colossal success in 2023, grossing $1.36 billion worldwide. Fans were ecstatic to see some of the most iconic video game characters of all time in a major motion picture. Though the astonishingly influential Nintendo games had been adapted before, in 1993, with Super Mario Bros., the film was a severe failure and has only gotten worse with age . The animated version, however, proved that retro video game movies can be spectacular with a dedicated story and voice cast. The film saw Mario, played by Chris Pratt, and Luigi, played by Charlie Day, enter the world of the Mushroom Kingdom ruled by the beautiful and fearless Princess Peach, played by Anya Taylor-Joy. The film featured tons of Easter eggs and references, and a humorous, engaging story that aligned perfectly with the games. Not much has been revealed about the sequel, but it's likely to introduce even more classic Mario characters and more threats for the brothers to face . 2 Hoppers Has a Creative Premise That May Inspire Deep Conversation Releasing March 6, 2026 Image via Pixar The teaser for Pixar's next feature, Hoppers, was released on July 16, 2025, and it's already garnered attention for its introspective look into nature. The film sees protagonist Mabel, as her brain is placed into the body of a beaver , so she can infiltrate a forest ecosystem and learn more about animals than humans thought possible . In doing so, she starts interfering with the natural order of things when she prevents a bear from eating a fellow beaver. The scientists who assisted in her transformation warn her about not disturbing nature, but Mabel seems committed to learning even more about her environment and protecting her animal friends. It seems that this film will include that signature emotional allure that many Pixar films contain . A balance of humor and heart is what the studio is known for, and Hoppers looks to invoke contemplative reactions from audiences that will leave the film making a lasting impression. 1 Wildwood Is Laika's First Film in Seven Years Releasing Sometime in 2026 Image via Laika Known for their stunning stop-motion films, including the whimsical and terrifying Coraline , Laika is finally set to deliver a new project that's sure to be nothing but spectacular. Wildwood , based on the novel by Colin Meloy , the lead singer and songwriter for the rock band The Decemberists, follows the hero protagonist Prue McKeel, whose younger brother is kidnapped and taken into the depths of a strange forest. The film is directed by Travis Knight, who directed another mystical Laika film, Kubo and the Two Strings . The screenplay is written by Chris Butler, who directed Laika's last film, Missing Link . The cast includes the voice talents of Jacob Tremblay, Carey Mulligan, Peyton Elizabeth Lee, Mahershala Ali, Maya Erskine and Charlie Day. With such a focus on winding woods, strange creatures and family bonds, Laika is the perfect studio to develop this story and is sure to entrance audiences with stellar stop-motion , immersing them in an expansive world that won't be easily forgotten. Summary: 1 day ago · With major studios and fresh voices in the mix, 2026 ’s animated films span fantasy, sci-fi, comedy, and heartfelt stories for all ages.
Full content: Bookmark These Biggest Animated Movies Releasing In 2026 SHOWS FOOD RECIPES TRAVEL HEALTH CULTURE STYLE & BEAUTY HOMES TECH UNLIMIT AWARDS 2026 RELATIONSHIPS WEDDINGS ASTROLOGY LOGIN LOGIN SHOWS FOOD RECIPES TRAVEL HEALTH CULTURE STYLE & BEAUTY HOMES TECH ASTROLOGY RELATIONSHIPS WEDDINGS UNLIMIT AWARDS 2026 MORE ZEST WATCH WEB STORIES PHOTO GALLERY QUIZ ZEST TIMELINE FEEDBACK ABOUT ZEEZEST ADVERTISE WITH US CONTACT US STAY CONNECTED: Home culture Animated Films Releasing In 2026 That Deserve Your Attention Animated Films Releasing In 2026 That Deserve Your Attention With major studios and fresh voices in the mix, 2026’s animated films span fantasy, sci-fi, comedy, and heartfelt stories for all ages. Swambhavi Sikdar Published On Dec 16, 2025 | Updated On Dec 17, 2025 Share On WhatsApp Share On Facebook Share On Twitter Copy Link Snapshots The animated blockbuster forecast for 2026 January release Charlie the Wonderdog February releases GOAT The Last Whale Singer March releases Hoppers The Pout-Pout Fish April release The Super Mario Galaxy Movie May release Animal Farm Animal Friends June release Toy Story 5 July release Minions 3 August release Coyote vs Acme September release Forgotten Island October release The Legend of Aang: The Last Airbender November releases The Cat in the Hat Hexed December release The Angry Birds Movie 3 Get ready for an extraordinary year! 2026 is shaping up to be a monumental period for animation, promising a cinematic feast for audiences of all ages. From the return of everyone’s beloved, billion dollar franchise like Toy Story 5 and Minions 3, to exciting original adventures like Pixar’s Hoppers and the unique sports comedy GOAT, the creative boundaries of the medium are being pushed further than ever before with the upcoming animated movies in 2026. Prepare to be enchanted, as classic tales are being reimagined and brand new worlds debut on the big screen! The animated blockbuster forecast for 2026 Hold onto your seats as 2026 is poised to be an unprecedented year for animated cinema, rolling out a dazzling schedule of your beloved franchise sequels and groundbreaking original tales that will redefine the medium. January release 1. Charlie the Wonderdog Follow the heartwarming journey of a shy boy, Danny, whose imagination transforms his cherished dog, Charlie into the superhero star of their own vibrant comic book world. A charming, action packed new animation movie in 2026, the film explores the power of friendship and magic of a child’s inner world. February releases 1. GOAT This 2026 animated film is the ultimate underdog story. A film from the visionary animation house behind Spider-Verse , this one is a kinetic and style driven sports comedy. Meet Will Harris, a young goat with aspirations of becoming a professional in the high intensity, futuristic sport of roarball. One of the best animated movies to release next year, this movie is an inspiring tale of talent, and grit that aims for greatness, produced by Stephen Curry. 2. The Last Whale Singer A new animation movie in 2026 that is an epic oceanic quest, this is a stunning, and soulful feature that follows a self doubting teenage humpback whale who must find his own voice and fight a monstrous leviathan to save his family and the ocean. Prepare yourself for a visually majestic and musically rich underwater epic with this upcoming animated movie in 2026. Myth Meets Modernity In The Divine Epic Mahavatar Narsimha March releases 1. Hoppers Pixar delivers another high concept original film with a scientific twist this time, in this 2026 animated film. Following the story of a 19-year old animal lover named Mabel, who gets a chance to use groundbreaking technology to ‘hop’ her consciousness into the bodies of various animals, this film promises a hilarious and surprising emotional exploration. Created from a perspective of empathy, Hoppers is surely one of the most awaited and best animated movies to release next year. 2. The Pout-Pout Fish Based on a beloved children’s book, this feature brings to life the hilarious and heartwarming story of a deep sea fish who believes his destiny is to simply sulk. A delightful journey of self discovery this upcoming animated movie in 2026 proves that happiness is a choice, even for a pout-pout fish. April release 1. The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Illumination and Nintendo blast off into space for a new cinematic Mario adventure. Reuniting the stellar voice cast, this sequel takes the Super Mario Brothers far beyond familiar territory and into the breathtaking, star-filled world of the Super Mario Galaxy game. May release 1. Animal Farm An upcoming animated movie in 2026, which is a classic that is reimagined, Animal Farm is based on George Orwell’s timeless and cautionary tale of farm animals who overthrow their human owners to create an egalitarian society. A stunning new animated adaptation of the novel, prepare for a visually powerful and thought provoking story about freedom, power, and corruption. 2. Animal Friends A 2026 animated film that is an R-rated road trip, Animal Friends is a departure from the traditional family friendly animation. This film centers around a road trip comedy that promises raucous and a star studded adventure as a cast of animated animals embark on a wild journey. June release 1. Toy Story 5 The gang is back, but this time with the stakes higher than ever! Buzz, Woody, Jessie, and the rest of the classic toys face a new reality where their jobs might be becoming exponentially complicated by new technology. This new animated movie in 2026 blends heart and modern themes in the fifth chapter of Pixar’s crown jewel. July release 1. Minions 3 The chaotic, yellow fan favourite creatures return for another anarchic comedy adventure in this upcoming animated movie in 2026. Gru’s beloved sidekicks are set to cause more hilarious trouble and confusion in a story that continues the blockbuster Despicable Me saga. August release 1. Coyote vs Acme The classic Looney Tunes gets a meta cinematic treatment in this new animated movie in 2026. Wile E Coyote finally hires a lawyer to sue the Acme Corporation for their dangerously faulty products in a visually dynamic, live action/animate courtroom comedy. Children’s Day: Movies That Will Bring Alive The Child Within You September release 1. Forgotten Island From DreamWorks Animation comes this captivating original adventure that is steeped in Philippine mythology. Two best friends find themselves trapped in a magical, hidden world where the only path home requires the ultimate sacrifice, that is forgetting each other forever. October release 1. The Legend of Aang: The Last Airbender The first animated feature film from Avatar Studios, this story focuses on Avatar Aang and his friends, Katara, Sokka, and Toph in their older years. A must see for fans, this 2026 animated film explores the next chapter for the heroes who saved the world. November releases 1. The Cat in the Hat Warner Bros. Animation revisits the whimsical world of Dr Seuss with a fresh, stylised blend of 2D and CG animation. Prepare for a colourful and zany adventure with the iconic and mischievous Cat in the Hat . 2. Hexed Walt Disney Animation Studios delivers an original fantasy with this 2026 animated film. An awkward teenage boy and his Type-A mom discover that he possesses magical powers, plunging them into a hidden world of spells and mystery that turns their lives wonderfully upside down. December release 1. The Angry Birds Movie 3 Red and Chuck return for the third installment of the blockbuster franchise based on a mobile game. Expect more flightless fury, green pig schemes, and a high flying, comedic battle for the survival of the Bird Island. **I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026** (source: https://www.cbr.com/most-anticipated-2026-animated-movies/)
Summary: Aug 6, 2025 · Animated releases in 2026 , including Minions 3 and Shrek 5, are expected to be some of the most exciting movies of the year.
Full content: I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie News Movie Features Movie Lists Movie Reviews TV Submenu TV News TV Features TV Lists TV Reviews Comics Submenu Comics News Comics Features Comics Lists Comics Previews Comics Reviews Anime Submenu Anime News Anime Features Anime Lists Games Submenu Game News Game Features Game Lists Game Guides Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Community Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads 2 More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards MCU, DCU & More Dragon Ball Lord of the Rings Procedurals & Dramas Westerns Zelda Close I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 Image by Morena Perez Vitale By Emme Oliver Published Aug 6, 2025 Emme Oliver is a writer and filmmaker from Bucks County, Pennsylvania. She obtained a Bachelor's of Arts in Screen Studies from The New School in 2024 and has written for popculturepress.org and switchbitchnoise.com. Her creative fiction has been published in numerous online magazines including Anti-Heroin Chic, The Scarlet Leaf Review, and Academy of the Heart and Mind. Her short film "Regression" was featured in the 2024 edition of The New Screen Fest Film Festival. Sign in to your CBR account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread 2 Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2025 has already seen some amazing movie releases, with Sinners dominating at the box office, ranking at number 11 on the list of the highest-grossing films of the year, according to Box Office Mojo . Superman and the live-action Lilo & Stitch remake have also done exceptionally well, bringing beloved characters back to the big screen. The end of the year is set to finish strong with Wicked: For Good , Avatar: Fire and Ash , and Five Nights at Freddy 's 2 set to release in November and December. Many animated films have fallen short, but the Chinese fantasy film N e Zha II is the highest-grossing film of 2025 thus far, and Disney is set to release the anticipated Zootopia 2 around Thanksgiving. 2026 is seeing the release of a variety of exciting animated films , including many sequels that are already inspiring hype in audiences who can't wait to see their favorite characters and new stories come to theaters. 10 Minions 3 Is Bound to Be Another Wacky Adventure Releasing July 1, 2026 Child Gru is intimidating one of the Minions in Minions: The Rise of Gru. Image via Illumination Minions: The Rise of Gru in 2022 made headlines not necessarily for critical reasons, but for its box office performance and an odd trend that may have been linked to its financial success. The "gentleminions" trend on TikTok saw several large groups of young men attending the film in suits, which seemed like a fun stunt until there were complaints about these viewers being particularly disruptive during screenings. Parents complained about not being able to enjoy the film with their kids because of littering, talking and other disturbances, which would appear again this year during A Minecraft Movie during the infamous "chicken jockey" scene . Minions 3 is likely not going to garner the same attention in meme culture as the trend died down once some theaters resorted to banning viewers in formal attire, but that won't stop families from attending to see the rambunctious yellow creatures get up to more mischief. Not many plot details about the film have been revealed, but Steve Carell is returning to voice Gru , and there are rumors that Alan Arkin will return as Wild Knuckles, who was prominently featured in the last film. 9 Ice Age 6 Will Hopefully Reinvigorate the Franchise Releasing December 18, 2026 Image Via 20th Century Animation With the critical bomb that was The Ice Age Adventures of Buck Wild , the last Ice Age film , things aren't looking so good for the franchise. With the first film being over two decades old, it may seem like audiences are tired of this franchise. However, the films have an exceptional voice cast with Ray Romano as Manny, Queen Latifah as Ellie, John Leguizamo as Sid and Simon Pegg as Buck. These are characters that audiences have grown up with and seen through catastrophic adventures. A story for the film hasn't been revealed yet , but an official poster for the film features familiar characters, including Brooke, voiced by Jessie J, and Shira, voiced by Jennifer Lopez, who are Sid and Diego's respective love interests. The poster sees Manny with his signature bulging eyes and worried expression while holding a spear, which could indicate another dangerous conflict for the found family of animals. 8 Goat is a Clever Play on Words For an Upcoming Sports Film Releasing February 13, 2026 Image Via Sony Pictures Animation Aside from a fun title and its appeal to basketball fans, Goat has an excellent creative team behind it. The film is directed by Tyree Dillihay, who is a director for the hit animated series Bob's Burgers , and Adam Rosette, who is a co-director at Sony Pictures Animation, known for his work on Orion and the Dark and The Wild Robot . Goat takes place in a world of anthropomorphic animals where a young goat named Will Harris dreams of becoming a professional basketball player despite his smaller stature. In addition to a great behind-the-scenes team, the cast is stacked with Stranger Things 's Caleb McLaughlin playing Will. His co-star, David Harbour, is also in the cast along with Nicola Coughlan, Nick Kroll, Gabrielle Union, Jenifer Lewis, Patton Oswalt and renowned basketball player Stephen Curry, who is also a producer for the film. The animation and designs for the animals are stunning, but it's to be expected from Sony Pictures Animation , whose inventive style has been impressing audiences since 2018 with Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse . 7 The Cat in the Hat Looks Like Another Inventive Dr. Seuss Story Brought to Life Releasing February 27, 2026 The Cat in the Hat poses in a car in the new movie. Image via Warner Bros. Many Dr. Seuss stories have made their way to the modern big screen in animated form, starting with Horton Hears a Who! in 2008 . Since then, Illumination has taken on the mantle, releasing The Lorax in 2012 and The Grinch in 2018. The Cat and the Hat is produced by Warner Bros. in the creative and popular 2.5D animation style, which melds hand-drawn animation with computer-generated animation. Comedian Bill Hader plays the chaotic Cat with Xochitl Gomez, Quinta Brunson, Matt Berry and Giancarlo Esposito also appearing in the cast. The film sees the Cat in the Hat , who has gained a reputation from the I.I.I.I. (Institute for the Institution of Imagination and Inspiration, LLC) for being irresponsible on his missions, facing his toughest task yet. He's tasked with cheering up two siblings who are struggling with their move to a new town. The film will bring some much-needed joy and laughter to audiences in addition to introducing Dr. Seuss's magical stories to new generations. 6 Shrek 5 Sees a New Chapter For the Ogre Family Releasing December 23, 2026 Shrek and Donkey scream in terror in Shrek 5 teaser Image via DreamWorks Animation Shrek 5 gained a massive amount of attention upon the release of its teaser earlier this year, with some Shrek fans complaining about the updated look of the characters and the changes that have been made to their design. Other fans expressed excitement over the original cast returning as well as the inclusion of Zendaya as Felicia, Shrek and Fiona's teenage daughter. The teaser is short, but it contains the same zippy and somewhat raunchy humor the series is known for , which is enough to have fans ready to be seated in theaters. As mentioned, Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy and Cameron Diaz are returning as Shrek, Donkey and Fiona. Other characters like Pinocchio and the Magic Mirror make an appearance, with the Magic Mirror acting almost like a phone screen showing different edits and memes of Shrek to the horror, surprise, and excitement of the family. Major story details aren't out in the open yet, but many are theorizing that it will center around the relationship between Shrek and Felicia and her potential rebellious streak. 5 Toy Story 5 Brings the Toys Back Once Again Releasing June 19, 2026 Woody looks at Bo in Toy Story 4 Image via Pixar Since Toy Story was released in 1995, Woody, Buzz, Mr. Potato Head, Rex and the whole gang have been warming the hearts of families. Though Pixar's eclectic catalog is full of classics, there aren't any films quite like the Toy Story franchise . Woody separating from the rest of his family to be a lost toy with Bo Peep didn't sit well with all audiences at the divisive ending of Toy Story 4 , and many are wondering what the fifth film will entail. The plot will revolve around a very pertinent premise, with the toys having to compete with electronics, which have captured the attention of kids. Woody is featured in the concept art on the official Pixar website, and Tom Hanks is listed in the cast, so Woody is bound to make an appearance. Jessie, Bullseye, Hamm, Slinky and Forky, who was introduced in the last film, are also in the released pictures, so it seems like everyone's favorite characters are returning for the next installment . 4 The Legendaries Looks Like an Epic Fantasy Film Releasing January 28, 2026 Image via Pan Cinema Based on the comic book series of the same name by Patrick Sobral, The Legendaries follows a group of heroes who protect the fantastical world of Alysia. While fighting a formidable sorcerer named Darkhell, they end up breaking a magical stone that turns the powerful warriors into young children. All of humanity is cursed, and the once-revered heroes are forced into hiding as they're blamed for the unfortunate circumstances. The film sees the young heroes reunite and restore their friendship, on a quest to become the warriors they once were. The film is being directed by Guillaume Ivernel, who is known for Dragon Hunters , Spycies , and Leap! . Though The Legendaries is being produced in and being released first in France, fantasy fans worldwide can look forward to this film, as well as fans of the original series . 3 The Super Mario Bros. Movie Sequel Is Expected to Be an Amazing Follow-Up Releasing May 14, 2026 Mario and Luigi celebrating a job well done in The Super Mario Bros. Movie Image via Universal Pictures The Super Mario Bros. Movie was a colossal success in 2023, grossing $1.36 billion worldwide. Fans were ecstatic to see some of the most iconic video game characters of all time in a major motion picture. Though the astonishingly influential Nintendo games had been adapted before, in 1993, with Super Mario Bros., the film was a severe failure and has only gotten worse with age . The animated version, however, proved that retro video game movies can be spectacular with a dedicated story and voice cast. The film saw Mario, played by Chris Pratt, and Luigi, played by Charlie Day, enter the world of the Mushroom Kingdom ruled by the beautiful and fearless Princess Peach, played by Anya Taylor-Joy. The film featured tons of Easter eggs and references, and a humorous, engaging story that aligned perfectly with the games. Not much has been revealed about the sequel, but it's likely to introduce even more classic Mario characters and more threats for the brothers to face . 2 Hoppers Has a Creative Premise That May Inspire Deep Conversation Releasing March 6, 2026 Image via Pixar The teaser for Pixar's next feature, Hoppers, was released on July 16, 2025, and it's already garnered attention for its introspective look into nature. The film sees protagonist Mabel, as her brain is placed into the body of a beaver , so she can infiltrate a forest ecosystem and learn more about animals than humans thought possible . In doing so, she starts interfering with the natural order of things when she prevents a bear from eating a fellow beaver. The scientists who assisted in her transformation warn her about not disturbing nature, but Mabel seems committed to learning even more about her environment and protecting her animal friends. It seems that this film will include that signature emotional allure that many Pixar films contain . A balance of humor and heart is what the studio is known for, and Hoppers looks to invoke contemplative reactions from audiences that will leave the film making a lasting impression. 1 Wildwood Is Laika's First Film in Seven Years Releasing Sometime in 2026 Image via Laika Known for their stunning stop-motion films, including the whimsical and terrifying Coraline , Laika is finally set to deliver a new project that's sure to be nothing but spectacular. Wildwood , based on the novel by Colin Meloy , the lead singer and songwriter for the rock band The Decemberists, follows the hero protagonist Prue McKeel, whose younger brother is kidnapped and taken into the depths of a strange forest. The film is directed by Travis Knight, who directed another mystical Laika film, Kubo and the Two Strings . The screenplay is written by Chris Butler, who directed Laika's last film, Missing Link . The cast includes the voice talents of Jacob Tremblay, Carey Mulligan, Peyton Elizabeth Lee, Mahershala Ali, Maya Erskine and Charlie Day. With such a focus on winding woods, strange creatures and family bonds, Laika is the perfect studio to develop this story and is sure to entrance audiences with stellar stop-motion , immersing them in an expansive world that won't be easily forgotten. Although major new IPs from giants like Disney and Pixar did badly at the box office, surprise hits – like KPop Demon Hunters becoming Netflix's most-streamed show ever – demonstrate a strong appetite for animation, including among adult audiences. The good news is that animation in 2026 is looking fantastic, with a strong bill of movies and series lined up. And while some of the biggest releases are sequels, there are also some original stories coming, including from giants like Pixar, Disney and DreamWorks. The critical 3D art trends that will impact 2026 9 animated movies and series to look out for in 2026 The Darwin Incident TVアニメ『ダーウィン事変』　第1弾PV／2026.01 OA AIR - YouTube Watch On Production company : Bellnox Films Release date : January 2026 Kicking of the best animation of 2026 in January, The Darwin Incident is a hotly anticipated series based on Shun Umezawa's award-winning manga. It follows the story of a 15-year-old "humanzee" hybrid called Charlie as he battles through the tribulations of US high school life and gets mixed up with an extremist eco-terrorist group that wants to take advantage of him. The series should be one of the most intellectual animations in 2026, exploring themes like identity, discrimination and moral limits as well as biotechnology. If Bellnox manages a faithful adaptation of the manga, it should be a gripping but thought-provoking animated thriller, and a great start for animated series in 2026. GOAT GOAT - Official Teaser Trailer (HD) - YouTube Watch On Production company : Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures Animation, Unanimous Media, Modern Magic Release date : 13 February, 2026 ZooTopia 2 hits the big screen this month, but Sony Animations is hoping it can steal Disney's glory and become the GOAT of new animated movies with anthropomorphic animals. This sports comedy directed by Tyree Dillihay applies a Spider Verse-like animation style to basketball action in the tale of a goat called Will Harris who gets a shot at the big time in 'roarball', a high-intensity contact sport where only the fastest and fiercest animals can shine. With KPop Demon Hunters, Sony has boosted its reputation for animation. GOAT will show whether it can now deliver at the box office outside of the Spider-Verse. Hoppers Hoppers | Teaser Trailer | In theaters March 6 - YouTube Watch On Production company: Pixar Animation Studios Release date: 6 March, 2026 Pixar's Elio failed to set box offices on fire in 2025. Can Hoppers make up for that and bring back Pixar's former glory for quirky original animations? Directed by Daniel Chong (We Bare Bears) from a screenplay by Jesse Andrews, the science-fiction comedy looks quite different from other Pixar movies. It could be helped by the featuring an older protagonist: 19-year-old animal lover Mabel Tanaka, whose uses technology to transfer her mind into a robotic beaver to join the animal world. Piper Curda, Bobby Moynihan and Jon Hamm are some of the voices. The Super Mario Galaxy Movie The Super Mario Galaxy Movie – Official Trailer - YouTube Watch On Production company: Illumination, Nintendo Release date: 3 April, 2026 The Super Mario Galaxy Movie reunites the cast from the 2023 film, with Chris Pratt as Mario alongside Anya Taylor-Joy, Charlie Day and Keegan-Michael Key. Some fans are concerned about the leap from Super Mario Bros to Super Mario Galaxy, which means skipping a bunch of Mario lore in Super Mario World, but we're looking forward to seeing what's in store for Bowser, whose personality is being explored more than in the games. You may like Could Stranger Things Tales from '85 be the ultimate retro cartoon? The critical 3D art trends that will impact 2026 Zootopia 2 could become Disney's biggest movie ever – here's how it was made In The Super Mario Bros. Movie, we saw King Koopa shrunken by a Mini Mushroom and imprisoned in a cage. It seems he's now been transferred into a magnificent castle where he's been 'working through his demons' and using art as a creative outlet. Daemons of the Shadow Realm Daemons of the Shadow Realm | Official Trailer 3 | Crunchyroll - YouTube Watch On Production company: Bones Film Release date: April 2026 After Fullmetal Alchemist and Silver Spoon, Hiromu Arakawa's Daemons of the Shadow Realm is hugely anticipated in the world of manga anime. The series looks set to deliver a return to high-concept fantasy storytelling. The story will explore the strength of sibling bonds, following two twins, Yuru and Asa, who were separated and tied to daemons. Arakawa has a reputation for developing complex moral themes in convincing worlds, and the upcoming animated series' looks like another perfect example. The rural world looks intriguing and mysterious, promising the perfect backdrop for a clash between ordinary lives with powerful supernatural forces. I'm hoping that Daemons of the Shadow Realm will be a modern fantasy classic. Toy Story 5 Toy Story 5 | Teaser Trailer | In Theaters June 19 - YouTube Watch On Production company: Pixar Animation Studios Release date: 19 June, 2026 Our team has been a bit torn over Toy Story 5. For many of us, the franchise feels like it's been part of our lives forever, so we have to include it in our list of animated movies to watch in 2026. Some fans have questioned the consistency of the timeline. Some also fear that the fifth installation sounds very similar to the first, but the premise of toys worried about being replaced feel more relevant than ever in this AI era. What we can agree on is that the animation in the trailer looks wonderfully polished (see the news on the release of RenderMan 27 if you want to try Pixar's rendering advances for yourself). Forgotten Island Production company: DreamWorks Release date: September 25, 2026 While Pixar has Hoppers and Disney has Hexed, Forgotten Island is DreamWorks' contender as a major studio original animated movie for 2026. We've not seen anything of this movie yet, but the concept sounds enticing, and curiously dark for a DreamWorks movie Forgotten Island will tell the story of two best friends trapped in a magical world with the only way home requiring them to forget each other forever. There's a star-studded voice cast lined up, with Lea Salonga, Dave Franco, Jenny Slate, Manny Jacinto, H.E.R. and Liza Soberano, and the movie will be directed by Joel Crawford, who did Puss in Boots. The Cat in the Hat The Cat in the Hat | Official Trailer - YouTube Watch On Production company: Warner Bros. Pictures Animation Release date: 6 November, 2026 The Cat and the Hat looks like it could be the closest Warner Bros has got yet to a Pixar-level animated movie. The Dr Seuss story will return to the big screen with a combination of stylised 2D animation and CG animation that should please fans who grew up with the book much more than that 2003 live-action movie with Mike Myers. The movie's being directed by Alessandro Carloni and Erica Rivinoja, with Bill Hader leading the voice cast and DNEG providing the animation. Some parts of the trailer remind me of the animation style of Nimona and also Max's Gremlins TV series. It looks like the style will change in the different worlds, veering towards CG realism in the real world while using cel shading in The Institute of Imagination. Hexed [Hexed] 2026년 가을 대개봉 - YouTube Watch On Production company: Walt Disney Animation Studios Release date: 25 November, 2026 We don't yet know much about Disney's Hexed, so perhaps it's a bit too early to say that it's one of the animated movies to watch in 2026, but we any new, original Disney movie is worth keeping an eye out for. All the studio has said is that Hexed will follow an awkward teenage boy and his 'Type A mom' as they discover that the lad might have magical powers. It sounds like the action will take place in the real world as well as a “secret world of magic”, both of which are turned upside down by the realisation. Disney's take on Harry Potter? We'll see, but it's notable that like Pixar's Hoppers this will see an teenage protagonist rather than a child, which could help the movie's fortunes. We're looking forward to the trailers to see what the animation style looks like. Fans of 2D animation are hoping that the movie will look like the beautifully stylised Hexed concept art that Disney released back in September, but will Disney really take a break from 3D? Upcoming animations further ahead in 2027 Further ahead, we have more exciting animation projects to look forward to in 2027. Big mainstream sequels will include Shrek 5 and Ice Age 6. Kojima Production's will bring its Death Stranding anime series to Disney+ (yes, really), and we'll also have the film that could take Indian animation global: Baahubali: The Eternal War Part 1 looks stunning with its Arcane-like art style mixing 2D and 3D animation. Want to work in animation yourself? Make sure you're familiar with the Disney principles of animation. **I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 - CBR** (source: https://www.cbr.com/most-anticipated-2026-animated-movies/)
Summary: Animated releases in 2026 , including Minions 3 and Shrek 5, are expected to be some of the most exciting movies of the year.
Full content: I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 Menu Sign in now Close Movies Submenu Movie News Movie Features Movie Lists Movie Reviews TV Submenu TV News TV Features TV Lists TV Reviews Comics Submenu Comics News Comics Features Comics Lists Comics Previews Comics Reviews Anime Submenu Anime News Anime Features Anime Lists Games Submenu Game News Game Features Game Lists Game Guides Videos More Submenu Lists Interviews Community Sign in Newsletter Menu Follow Followed Like Threads 2 More Action Summary Generate a summary of this story Sign in now Screen Awards MCU, DCU & More Dragon Ball Lord of the Rings Procedurals & Dramas Westerns Zelda Close I'm So Excited for These 10 Animated Movies Releasing in 2026 Image by Morena Perez Vitale By Emme Oliver Published Aug 6, 2025 Emme Oliver is a writer and filmmaker from Bucks County, Pennsylvania. She obtained a Bachelor's of Arts in Screen Studies from The New School in 2024 and has written for popculturepress.org and switchbitchnoise.com. Her creative fiction has been published in numerous online magazines including Anti-Heroin Chic, The Scarlet Leaf Review, and Academy of the Heart and Mind. Her short film "Regression" was featured in the 2024 edition of The New Screen Fest Film Festival. Sign in to your CBR account Summary Generate a summary of this story follow Follow followed Followed Like Like Thread 2 Log in Here is a fact-based summary of the story contents: Try something different: Show me the facts Explain it like I’m 5 Give me a lighthearted recap 2025 has already seen some amazing movie releases, with Sinners dominating at the box office, ranking at number 11 on the list of the highest-grossing films of the year, according to Box Office Mojo . Superman and the live-action Lilo & Stitch remake have also done exceptionally well, bringing beloved characters back to the big screen. The end of the year is set to finish strong with Wicked: For Good , Avatar: Fire and Ash , and Five Nights at Freddy 's 2 set to release in November and December. Many animated films have fallen short, but the Chinese fantasy film N e Zha II is the highest-grossing film of 2025 thus far, and Disney is set to release the anticipated Zootopia 2 around Thanksgiving. 2026 is seeing the release of a variety of exciting animated films , including many sequels that are already inspiring hype in audiences who can't wait to see their favorite characters and new stories come to theaters. 10 Minions 3 Is Bound to Be Another Wacky Adventure Releasing July 1, 2026 Child Gru is intimidating one of the Minions in Minions: The Rise of Gru. Image via Illumination Minions: The Rise of Gru in 2022 made headlines not necessarily for critical reasons, but for its box office performance and an odd trend that may have been linked to its financial success. The "gentleminions" trend on TikTok saw several large groups of young men attending the film in suits, which seemed like a fun stunt until there were complaints about these viewers being particularly disruptive during screenings. Parents complained about not being able to enjoy the film with their kids because of littering, talking and other disturbances, which would appear again this year during A Minecraft Movie during the infamous "chicken jockey" scene . Minions 3 is likely not going to garner the same attention in meme culture as the trend died down once some theaters resorted to banning viewers in formal attire, but that won't stop families from attending to see the rambunctious yellow creatures get up to more mischief. Not many plot details about the film have been revealed, but Steve Carell is returning to voice Gru , and there are rumors that Alan Arkin will return as Wild Knuckles, who was prominently featured in the last film. 9 Ice Age 6 Will Hopefully Reinvigorate the Franchise Releasing December 18, 2026 Image Via 20th Century Animation With the critical bomb that was The Ice Age Adventures of Buck Wild , the last Ice Age film , things aren't looking so good for the franchise. With the first film being over two decades old, it may seem like audiences are tired of this franchise. However, the films have an exceptional voice cast with Ray Romano as Manny, Queen Latifah as Ellie, John Leguizamo as Sid and Simon Pegg as Buck. These are characters that audiences have grown up with and seen through catastrophic adventures. A story for the film hasn't been revealed yet , but an official poster for the film features familiar characters, including Brooke, voiced by Jessie J, and Shira, voiced by Jennifer Lopez, who are Sid and Diego's respective love interests. The poster sees Manny with his signature bulging eyes and worried expression while holding a spear, which could indicate another dangerous conflict for the found family of animals. 8 Goat is a Clever Play on Words For an Upcoming Sports Film Releasing February 13, 2026 Image Via Sony Pictures Animation Aside from a fun title and its appeal to basketball fans, Goat has an excellent creative team behind it. The film is directed by Tyree Dillihay, who is a director for the hit animated series Bob's Burgers , and Adam Rosette, who is a co-director at Sony Pictures Animation, known for his work on Orion and the Dark and The Wild Robot . Goat takes place in a world of anthropomorphic animals where a young goat named Will Harris dreams of becoming a professional basketball player despite his smaller stature. In addition to a great behind-the-scenes team, the cast is stacked with Stranger Things 's Caleb McLaughlin playing Will. His co-star, David Harbour, is also in the cast along with Nicola Coughlan, Nick Kroll, Gabrielle Union, Jenifer Lewis, Patton Oswalt and renowned basketball player Stephen Curry, who is also a producer for the film. The animation and designs for the animals are stunning, but it's to be expected from Sony Pictures Animation , whose inventive style has been impressing audiences since 2018 with Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse . 7 The Cat in the Hat Looks Like Another Inventive Dr. Seuss Story Brought to Life Releasing February 27, 2026 The Cat in the Hat poses in a car in the new movie. Image via Warner Bros. Many Dr. Seuss stories have made their way to the modern big screen in animated form, starting with Horton Hears a Who! in 2008 . Since then, Illumination has taken on the mantle, releasing The Lorax in 2012 and The Grinch in 2018. The Cat and the Hat is produced by Warner Bros. in the creative and popular 2.5D animation style, which melds hand-drawn animation with computer-generated animation. Comedian Bill Hader plays the chaotic Cat with Xochitl Gomez, Quinta Brunson, Matt Berry and Giancarlo Esposito also appearing in the cast. The film sees the Cat in the Hat , who has gained a reputation from the I.I.I.I. (Institute for the Institution of Imagination and Inspiration, LLC) for being irresponsible on his missions, facing his toughest task yet. He's tasked with cheering up two siblings who are struggling with their move to a new town. The film will bring some much-needed joy and laughter to audiences in addition to introducing Dr. Seuss's magical stories to new generations. 6 Shrek 5 Sees a New Chapter For the Ogre Family Releasing December 23, 2026 Shrek and Donkey scream in terror in Shrek 5 teaser Image via DreamWorks Animation Shrek 5 gained a massive amount of attention upon the release of its teaser earlier this year, with some Shrek fans complaining about the updated look of the characters and the changes that have been made to their design. Other fans expressed excitement over the original cast returning as well as the inclusion of Zendaya as Felicia, Shrek and Fiona's teenage daughter. The teaser is short, but it contains the same zippy and somewhat raunchy humor the series is known for , which is enough to have fans ready to be seated in theaters. As mentioned, Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy and Cameron Diaz are returning as Shrek, Donkey and Fiona. Other characters like Pinocchio and the Magic Mirror make an appearance, with the Magic Mirror acting almost like a phone screen showing different edits and memes of Shrek to the horror, surprise, and excitement of the family. Major story details aren't out in the open yet, but many are theorizing that it will center around the relationship between Shrek and Felicia and her potential rebellious streak. 5 Toy Story 5 Brings the Toys Back Once Again Releasing June 19, 2026 Woody looks at Bo in Toy Story 4 Image via Pixar Since Toy Story was released in 1995, Woody, Buzz, Mr. Potato Head, Rex and the whole gang have been warming the hearts of families. Though Pixar's eclectic catalog is full of classics, there aren't any films quite like the Toy Story franchise . Woody separating from the rest of his family to be a lost toy with Bo Peep didn't sit well with all audiences at the divisive ending of Toy Story 4 , and many are wondering what the fifth film will entail. The plot will revolve around a very pertinent premise, with the toys having to compete with electronics, which have captured the attention of kids. Woody is featured in the concept art on the official Pixar website, and Tom Hanks is listed in the cast, so Woody is bound to make an appearance. Jessie, Bullseye, Hamm, Slinky and Forky, who was introduced in the last film, are also in the released pictures, so it seems like everyone's favorite characters are returning for the next installment . 4 The Legendaries Looks Like an Epic Fantasy Film Releasing January 28, 2026 Image via Pan Cinema Based on the comic book series of the same name by Patrick Sobral, The Legendaries follows a group of heroes who protect the fantastical world of Alysia. While fighting a formidable sorcerer named Darkhell, they end up breaking a magical stone that turns the powerful warriors into young children. All of humanity is cursed, and the once-revered heroes are forced into hiding as they're blamed for the unfortunate circumstances. The film sees the young heroes reunite and restore their friendship, on a quest to become the warriors they once were. The film is being directed by Guillaume Ivernel, who is known for Dragon Hunters , Spycies , and Leap! . Though The Legendaries is being produced in and being released first in France, fantasy fans worldwide can look forward to this film, as well as fans of the original series . 3 The Super Mario Bros. Movie Sequel Is Expected to Be an Amazing Follow-Up Releasing May 14, 2026 Mario and Luigi celebrating a job well done in The Super Mario Bros. Movie Image via Universal Pictures The Super Mario Bros. Movie was a colossal success in 2023, grossing $1.36 billion worldwide. Fans were ecstatic to see some of the most iconic video game characters of all time in a major motion picture. Though the astonishingly influential Nintendo games had been adapted before, in 1993, with Super Mario Bros., the film was a severe failure and has only gotten worse with age . The animated version, however, proved that retro video game movies can be spectacular with a dedicated story and voice cast. The film saw Mario, played by Chris Pratt, and Luigi, played by Charlie Day, enter the world of the Mushroom Kingdom ruled by the beautiful and fearless Princess Peach, played by Anya Taylor-Joy. The film featured tons of Easter eggs and references, and a humorous, engaging story that aligned perfectly with the games. Not much has been revealed about the sequel, but it's likely to introduce even more classic Mario characters and more threats for the brothers to face . 2 Hoppers Has a Creative Premise That May Inspire Deep Conversation Releasing March 6, 2026 Image via Pixar The teaser for Pixar's next feature, Hoppers, was released on July 16, 2025, and it's already garnered attention for its introspective look into nature. The film sees protagonist Mabel, as her brain is placed into the body of a beaver , so she can infiltrate a forest ecosystem and learn more about animals than humans thought possible . In doing so, she starts interfering with the natural order of things when she prevents a bear from eating a fellow beaver. The scientists who assisted in her transformation warn her about not disturbing nature, but Mabel seems committed to learning even more about her environment and protecting her animal friends. It seems that this film will include that signature emotional allure that many Pixar films contain . A balance of humor and heart is what the studio is known for, and Hoppers looks to invoke contemplative reactions from audiences that will leave the film making a lasting impression. 1 Wildwood Is Laika's First Film in Seven Years Releasing Sometime in 2026 Image via Laika Known for their stunning stop-motion films, including the whimsical and terrifying Coraline , Laika is finally set to deliver a new project that's sure to be nothing but spectacular. Wildwood , based on the novel by Colin Meloy , the lead singer and songwriter for the rock band The Decemberists, follows the hero protagonist Prue McKeel, whose younger brother is kidnapped and taken into the depths of a strange forest. The film is directed by Travis Knight, who directed another mystical Laika film, Kubo and the Two Strings . The screenplay is written by Chris Butler, who directed Laika's last film, Missing Link . The cast includes the voice talents of Jacob Tremblay, Carey Mulligan, Peyton Elizabeth Lee, Mahershala Ali, Maya Erskine and Charlie Day. With such a focus on winding woods, strange creatures and family bonds, Laika is the perfect studio to develop this story and is sure to entrance audiences with stellar stop-motion , immersing them in an expansive world that won't be easily forgotten. Although major new IPs from giants like Disney and Pixar did badly at the box office, surprise hits – like KPop Demon Hunters becoming Netflix's most-streamed show ever – demonstrate a strong appetite for animation, including among adult audiences. The good news is that animation in 2026 is looking fantastic, with a strong bill of movies and series lined up. And while some of the biggest releases are sequels, there are also some original stories coming, including from giants like Pixar, Disney and DreamWorks. Could 2026 be the year of the animation revival? Here's our pick of the best animated movies and series to look out for throughout the coming year. The critical 3D art trends that will impact 2026 9 animated movies and series to look out for in 2026 The Darwin Incident TVアニメ『ダーウィン事変』　第1弾PV／2026.01 OA AIR - YouTube Watch On Production company : Bellnox Films Release date : January 2026 Kicking of the best animation of 2026 in January, The Darwin Incident is a hotly anticipated series based on Shun Umezawa's award-winning manga. It follows the story of a 15-year-old "humanzee" hybrid called Charlie as he battles through the tribulations of US high school life and gets mixed up with an extremist eco-terrorist group that wants to take advantage of him. The series should be one of the most intellectual animations in 2026, exploring themes like identity, discrimination and moral limits as well as biotechnology. If Bellnox manages a faithful adaptation of the manga, it should be a gripping but thought-provoking animated thriller, and a great start for animated series in 2026. GOAT GOAT - Official Teaser Trailer (HD) - YouTube Watch On Production company : Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures Animation, Unanimous Media, Modern Magic Release date : 13 February, 2026 ZooTopia 2 hits the big screen this month, but Sony Animations is hoping it can steal Disney's glory and become the GOAT of new animated movies with anthropomorphic animals. This sports comedy directed by Tyree Dillihay applies a Spider Verse-like animation style to basketball action in the tale of a goat called Will Harris who gets a shot at the big time in 'roarball', a high-intensity contact sport where only the fastest and fiercest animals can shine. With KPop Demon Hunters, Sony has boosted its reputation for animation. GOAT will show whether it can now deliver at the box office outside of the Spider-Verse. Hoppers Hoppers | Teaser Trailer | In theaters March 6 - YouTube Watch On Production company: Pixar Animation Studios Release date: 6 March, 2026 Pixar's Elio failed to set box offices on fire in 2025. Can Hoppers make up for that and bring back Pixar's former glory for quirky original animations? Directed by Daniel Chong (We Bare Bears) from a screenplay by Jesse Andrews, the science-fiction comedy looks quite different from other Pixar movies. It could be helped by the featuring an older protagonist: 19-year-old animal lover Mabel Tanaka, whose uses technology to transfer her mind into a robotic beaver to join the animal world. Piper Curda, Bobby Moynihan and Jon Hamm are some of the voices. The Super Mario Galaxy Movie The Super Mario Galaxy Movie – Official Trailer - YouTube Watch On Production company: Illumination, Nintendo Release date: 3 April, 2026 The Super Mario Galaxy Movie reunites the cast from the 2023 film, with Chris Pratt as Mario alongside Anya Taylor-Joy, Charlie Day and Keegan-Michael Key. Some fans are concerned about the leap from Super Mario Bros to Super Mario Galaxy, which means skipping a bunch of Mario lore in Super Mario World, but we're looking forward to seeing what's in store for Bowser, whose personality is being explored more than in the games.
